title: Excellent Oil
body: It seems like every where you turn these days someone is making Fish Oil. Slap a fancy label on it and call it Alaskan Iced Fish Poop Oil and people will buy it. Don't be those people!

title: I definitely recommend this product
body: I check with ConsumerLab.com before purchasing supplements. Viva Labs Omega 3 Fish Oil was one of the approved supplements and it specifically meets my doctor's recommendation. They sometimes have fishy burps, but not all of the time.  I definitely recommend this product.

title: Why this is the best omega-3 supplement
body: There's significant evidence showing omega-3 improves heart & brain health. Omega-3s are “essential” fatty acids because the body can't produce them on their own and so we must rely on food & supplements. There are 3 types: ALA, DHA, EPA. Plant-based foods provide ALA, while seafood sources provide DHA & EPA. The positive health benefits of omega-3 are linked mostly with DHA and EPA. The American Heart Association recommends you get 1g of DHA+EPA per day. Hence the need for a fish oil supplement.

title: Personally, I think this is the best fish oil product out there. I use it for my dog's atopic dermatitis.
body: I bought this product for my dogs, one of which has severe allergies causing atopic dermatitis. Fish oil can be highly effective in helping with canine, and human, allergies. I researched a ton of products before buying this one. Viva Naturals had the highest amounts of EPA and DHA Omegas of any brand I could find. EPA and DHA are the key fatty acids involved in mitigating the allergic response.

title: No more joint pain.
body: I started taking a fish oil supplement for a clinical trial on eye dryness. What I noticed to my surprise was my joints did not hurt anymore. My knees hurt so bad going down the stairs I had to grimace. 4000 milligrams of fish oil stopped the pain.  I recommend it highly.

title: Triple strength and great quality
body: I was using a liquid fish oil made by a top manufacturer. It was not ideal because the oil would drip down the bottle, and then when I picked up the bottle, the old oil would make my hands smell bad. I thought I had no other choice because I needed a high quality product with very high EPAs. Then I found out about Viva Naturals. I wish I'd found this supplement a long time ago. Not only does it fit all my requirements but it is also amazingly affordable. Another plus: I can take it with me when I travel. And I never get a fishy aftertaste. I highly recommended it.

title: My 44 year old joints feel like new!
body: I'm almost through my first bottle and so far its working great. I've had chronic knee and shoulder pain for the last 20 years and I'm noticing much improvement.  My shoulder had developed an impingement due to weight lifting but after using this product its completely gone. Ive had two knee surgerys on my right knee due to a meniscus tear causing me to ice my knees every night. I am amazed at how well my knee is doing now, I am back in the gym squatting 300+ with no knee pain at all and, I'm bench pressing heavy weight again, which I had stoppec due to my shoulder pain. I highly recommend this product if you suffer from any joint pain at all.

title: The fish burp wasn't that bad, just annoying
body: New to the Viva Naturals brand and in need of fish oil, I decided to give it a try.  The pills seemed a bit larger than another brand I've tried in the past.  I did experience the dreaded fish burp, but I'm not one that would discontinue use for that reason alone.  The fish burp wasn't that bad, just annoying.  However, after trying the pills, I experienced dreadful gastrointestinal problems.  Very bad case of diarrhea the first and second day.  This made me weak, frustrated, and not well for two days.  I'm giving the product a 4 rating because when I contacted the seller they were very prompt to respond.  While the product did not work for me, it may work for others.  We are all different.  Some of us more sensitivities than others.  Perhaps this particular product offered too much for my body, but I experienced GI problems after only taken the 1st dose.  I have taken other fish oil brands in the past that did not result in any GI issues, not sure what happened here.  Bad batch, or just not a good match, but they are a great company because they believe in providing excellent customer service.

I purchased them for mood support as I transitioned off an antidepressant I was taking for postpartum depression. I have noticed a positive change in the last few weeks of taking them consistently with dinner. The pills are very large, which doesn't bother me but may be a factor to consider. Lots of other health benefits too, so if you're looking for mood support it doesn't hurt to try them.

title: High quality, high potency omega supplement.
body: If you are already taking omega supplements you are presumably aware of the potential benefits. You should know that not all supplements are the same. Some don't offer level of potency they claim to, and fish oil is fragile. If poorly handled during processing it could become contaminated, or oxidize. To sift through all of this since these are unregulated - look for third party certification specifically from IFOS. Viva passes all of their tests and this particular product is the most potent in their offering. It is well priced considering what is in each pill. Lastly I appreciate the follow-up I received directly from the company post purchase. From what I have experienced, it seems like integrity is embedded in what they aim to do.

title: Unclear nutritional label but good product
body: The supplement itself appears to be of high quality - no fishy burps, etc. My only complaint is that the information on the bottle is a bit misleading. When purchasing this product I used the nutritional information label when deciding against other fish oil options. I ended up purchasing this fish oil because it offered more servings of high quality fish oil for a better price. After receiving the product I noticed some inconsistencies on the label. The label states that a serving is 2 capsules & that there is 90 servings per bottle. One would assume that the bottle would contain 180 capsules (90 servings x 2 capsules per serving), but instead the bottle has 90 softgels. Searching the bottle for more info, I found that the front of the bottle states "90 capsules". This leaves me confused - It is either 90 servings of 1 capsule or 45 servings of 2 capsules. I did not notice this inconsistency until almost finishing the bottle so I hope there is no adverse health effects of taking double the recommended serving (if it is indeed 1 capsule per serving).

title: Best Fish Oil for Sleep
body: I have been taking this fish oil for some time.  I have sleep issues and when I started taking the fist oil every day, my sleep improved,  its not at 100% but when I don't take two caps at night I know I wake up more often, instead of sleeping through the night.  This product is very clean fish oil.  I put the bottle in the freezer to keep the caps fresh.  Do not listen to anyone saying negative things about this product. There is no after taste, no upset stomach ache.  This is how you test great fish oil.  Take styrofoam cups and place two fish oil caps in the bottom of the cup, cover wth a little water and wait to they disolve.  Clean fish oil will not leak through the styrofoam cups.  Rancid fish oil will leak through the styrofoam cup onto your counter.  We had 3-4 different types in the house and everyone other brand failed the test except this brand.  Also remember people who say negative things about this product may not be eating a clean diet, maybe eating all kinds of junk food, or processed food. title: Great product and great representatives!
body: I bought this as my first fish oil purchase. I was looking at the EPA an DHA amount, and this had a good amount of both for someone getting into weightlifting. I am 215LB, mostly muscle with a layer of flab covering everything as I used to way 280lb.  I have had no side affects taking this product, I feel normal as I always have.  Everyone should know that fish oil is important for you health and especially for weight lifting and aiding muscle growth. This works for my regime.  I take 3 tablets every morning with my protein shake, right before work. When I get into work, I eat my breakfast.  I am about 4-5 more doses before the end of bottle.

title: Cronic dry eye
body: I have been taking station for years and have had Cronic dry eye as a side effect from the reduced omega 3/6. It was so bad that I had to apply ointments to lubricate my eye overnight if not my eye lid would stick to the cornea and result in pain. After one month on this supplement I stopped applying the nighttime drops.

title: One of the best fish oils on the market
body: One of the best fish oils on the market, per LabDoor, a lab that tests vitamins and supplements and posts their results online for the public.  Great to be able to order (and consume) with confidence that these will not be oxidizing any time soon and causing the problems they are designed to prevent!  We had no fish breath like I got with the Target brand, which is awesome :)

title: Two Stars
body: definitely had a fish taste, and they are tooo big for me.  Will not order again.

title: Great Results
body: I ordered these fish oil pills to use in an attempt to lower my cholesterol at the suggestion of my doctor who would have preferred to prescribe me a statin. I am a 38 year old female weighing 135 and I am 5'6" tall. I am not overweight and I eat (mostly) a healthy diet. The doctor (based on my family history) said it was not was I was eating that was making my cholesterol so high, but heredity. Though the directions say to take 2 soft gels daily following a complete meal, I only took 1 each night after dinner. I did not change my diet at all. Before starting the fish oil my total cholesterol was 255, with the "bad"  LDL at 175 and the "good" HDL at 58. In JUST UNDER ONE MONTH, my cholesterol went down to 238. LDL down to 159 and HDL up to 65. My doctor and I were both very pleased and I continue to take one pill daily. Excellent product. No odor, no bad taste, and no fish-burps.

title: Apparently fresh fish oil.
body: I am concerned about the freshness and purity of any supplement I take.  I bite the capsule in my mouth and then ingest the oil. The fish oil is relatively tasteless, a good thing, and not rancid.  I am generally concerned, too, about any mercury content in this and any fish oil supplement.

title: Very good product.
body: It is surprisingly a very good product. Doesn't upset my stomach like the other brands of fish oil that I tried before. I have been using this fish oil only for few days and I have already noticed some improvement in my  arthritis. My finger joins are less swollen and less painful. I am going to order a second bottle .

title: I highly recommend this product because it increased the good cholesterol
body: I highly recommend this product because it increased the good cholesterol, HDL and my husband wasn't burping up fish oil all day long. Only 4 stars, because they increased the price by $5 since my last purchased 4 months ago.The new package included an unnecessary box which serves no purpose other than to enhance the product's "marketing look" and make it appear more expensive.  Sadly, it is a waste of our precious environmental resources with a touch of greed.

title: Great Value for Excellent Quality
body: Better priced quality alternative to Nutrigold triple strength Omega 3, the price of which has spiked over time.  Viva Labs' Omega 3 ultra strength has a one capsule a day formulation similar to Nutrigold.  It is totally burp free and although the soft capsule is somewhat large, it slides down the throat quite easily.  I recommend this brand if you are tired of Nutrigold's pricing increases.  I intend to stick with Viva Labs Omega 3 Fish Oil for now.

title: Fish Oil Review
body: I'm an American working in Shanghai for the past two years. My colleague asked me to purchase the supplement for her father who recently is showing symptoms of memory loss. I can't say I have evidence of efficacy, but I can say that the Viva product appears to be high quality and well packaged. I chose this particular brand because of the potency and also because the oil is extracted from wild fish. Similar products can be found in China. However, there's always a concern that the project purchases in China may be counterfeit or lower in potency than indicated. That is why I purchase them in the USA and fly them back with me for my colleague.

title: So far I am happy with my purchase
body: I checked labdoor.com and purchased this bottle because it has the highest value ranking. So far I am happy with my purchase. I am going through a lot of stress lately (I am a PhD student, never short of that) and these capsules definitely help. No fishy taste but don't drink something hot right after taking it. I usually steer away from products that contains gelatin due to dietary restrictions but the gelatin in this fits my diet so I was extra pleased when I saw that. Definitely recommend it.

title: BEST ONE - NO AFTERTASTE/FISHY BURPS!
body: I don't like the "fish burps" so I haven't taken Fish Oil in so long until my doctor recommended that I should start taking Fish Oil daily.

title: Viva's absorption is a ton better!

title: High quality, 5 star rated by independent testing.
body: I've learned to steer clear of no-name, drug chain brands of supplements. This product is very good Omega 3. Got a bit of fishy taste when I first started using them, but have decided to swallow them immediately before loading my mouth with 14 other supplements. Since the change no fishy taste. Viva Labs Omega 3 Fish Oil has a 5 star rating according to the IFOS, The International Fish Oil Standards Program. This is crucial for those of us who care what we put into our bodies, according to IFOS, they are "the only third party testing and certification program for fish oils. IFOS sets the world's highest standards for purity, potency and freshness." I wish they had organizations like this for all supplements. Until then I'll keep reading and learning.

title: Great source of Omega 3's, just make sure you wash them down with a larger meal!
body: Great way to get all of your essential oils, but make sure you eat them with food and a slightly heavier meal. I took them once on an empty stomach and definitely had the fish burps. I also had fish burps after taking them with a light lunch. Since then, I've taken one at breakfast and one at dinner, those two meals happen to be my largest meals of the day. Once I started to do that, there were no issues. I did and do a lot of research before buying supplements or vitamins of any kind and I suggest you do the same. A great site called Labdoor gives in-depth reviews of all different types of vitamins and supplements. Their rating are based on the the actual percentage of, in this case fish oil, is in the pill compared to what the label states. It further breaks it down by Best overall, best for price, etc... Great site. These particular pills were ranked in their top 3 and were also in their top 5 for value. So, that's how I personally ended up choosing them. Highly recommended, just make sure you take them with a larger meal and not before a date! haha!

title: I can't say that this product is better or worse than other fish oil products I've tried
body: I can't say that this product is better or worse than other fish oil products I've tried. However, the overwhelmingly glowing reviews by everyone is highly suspicious. For one, not one person who has written a review is credited with being a verified purchaser. And for two, it is highly unreasonable for virtually every single review written by those who've received this product free or at a discount to be positive with 5 stars, all while claiming their review is unbiased. It all comes across as very suspicious.

title: Ok, but just not with my meds
body: I have taken fish oil (different brand) for a long time prior to purchasing this product with no ill effect.  But, because my doctor was concerned about the efficacy of the other brand, I did a lot of research.  Even though this product is not USP verified (preferred by my doctor), it is still reviewed by and found compliant with IFOS (International Fish Oil Standards).  The Consumer Report provided by IFOS concerns me, however, and I am awaiting a reply from IFOS about the discrepancies..."Batch Results" in 2 of 4 categories are exactly the same as the IFOS "Standard Limits". I am going to try a different brand with more accurate (and mostly, lower) results than this brand since it appears to have an affect on other medications I am taking.

title: Major reduction of triglycerides
body: I take three caps a day... Reduced my triglycerides from 400 to 142.  Amazing.  My doc was impressed and I am as well.  This isn't your grocery pharmacy fish oil!

title: Excellent product (no kidding)
body: I am a stroke Survivor and as such need to keep my triglycerides and cholesterol at heathier  levels than the norm. My insurance would not cover the prescription omega 3 medication as my current levels were apparently not severe  enough. Off I  went on a search of a quality omega 3 suppliment as came across these. I thought they were a bit pricy for the quantity but I figured I'd give it a shot. I bought 2 bottles and took 2 pills  twice daily. After 2 months I had my follow up with my dr. who was impressed and a little shocked....triglycerides went from 302 to 156. Total cholesterol from 323 to 197. Sure I improved my diet and exercise but no drastic changes. Not making any medical claims here but I feel confident these supplements played a significant part in bringing my numbers to healthy levels. Highly recommend.

title: No fishy burps!!!
body: No joke, these are probably the best fish oils I've ever used... sure, they're a bit of a doozy to swallow (they're pretty enormous--see picture), but unlike most other fish oils, they don't give you the fish burps. You can take them without fear that you'll reek of seafood every time you open your mouth... not to mention the simple DHA/EPA amounts are perfect for daily dosage.

title: 1st to actually have a huge effect..
body: Well for all the back & forth re which brand actually works, all I can say is this:

title: Best fish oil by far!
body: My rheumotologist suggested I research fish oil. I did and decided to try Omegavia. I am absolutely convinced this is an outstanding product and is higher in omega 3 than ANY product available in stores. I have compared it to every fish oil available at the big chain stores as well as the clubs. Omegavia beats them all for % of omega 3. My inflammation is significantly reduced. I used to be barely able to move in the morning. Now I barely have any stiffness in the morning upon waking. I would recommend this product to anyone suffering from inflammation.

title: I decided to start taking fish oil again and did some research to find a good one. I decided to try Omega Via and ...
body: I have taken fish oil for years and always felt there were some benefits. I had oral surgery and stopped taking it due to risk of increased bleeding. I have noticed recently that both of my knees have started to ache and swell again. That had not happened for quite some time. Then I developed gout in my right big toe. Those that have not experienced gout, pray that you never do. I missed several days of work because I was unable to get a sock on my foot let alone a boot. I decided to start taking fish oil again and did some research to find a good one. I decided to try Omega Via and what a blessing. title: Excellent Marketing, Inferior Absorption Form, Look elsewhere...again EXCELLENT MARKETING
body: FOR ALL PEOPLE NEW TO FISH OIL, PLEASE LISTEN. OmegaVia has a very aggressive, blog-like marketing team pushing this product on the Internet. If one searches "enteric coated fish oil" on Google, their website is the first to come up, listing all the benefits of enteric-coated fish oil, naturally. In fact, just searching any number of questions regarding fish oil will bring up Vin Kutty's blog on omegavia.com (the owner, always a bad sign). The "health blog" is just strangely written, vacillating between product placement and shooing contrary evidence (e.g. about the bioavailibliy of different forms of fish oil) under the rug. Check it out yourself. Enteric coating is almost certainly unnecessary for the absorption of fish oil in the human body (Lovaza, the actual fish oil-based pharmaceutical drug used for lowering triglycerides, is not even enteric coated!) save for a few potential exotic applications such as Crohn's Disease (and even these have marginal benefits). Do not be hoodwinked by marketing. It should be clear this is NOT the triglyceride form of fish oil, the most bioavailible form. This is the ethyl-ester (EE) form, a semi-synthetic form which is easier to manufacture (interestingly, it's the active ingredient in Lovaza as well, which raises all sorts of questions the FDA might be interested in investigating). DO NOT BE FOOLED BY THE PROFESSED HIGHER AMOUNTS OF EPA AND DHA. While technically yes there are higher "amounts," this specific form (EE) is more poorly available to the body. This isn't intended to be a product plug, but most of Nordic Natural's stuff is triglyceride form, the primary reason they're so expensive. Bottom line: Don't waste your time with this stuff. They have excellent marketing, but the product is overpriced, less effective than the triglyceride form, and questionably legal due to their addition of an active pharmaceutical ingredient in accordance to the FDA's Dietary Supplement Health and Education Act of 1994 (DSHEA).

body: After extensive research, I decided to give OmegaVia a shot. I have high triglycerides and high cholesterol and I really don't want to be put on medications. The package arrived earlier than expected. Upon opening the container, there was no fishy smell and all of the capsules were in tact. I was worried about the size of the pills based on other reviews, but in comparison to the Triple Strength Fish Oil that I have been taking from GNC, these pills are actually a little bit smaller. I am currently taking one OmegaVia and one GNC Fish oil per day in the hopes that when I go back to the Dr in three weeks for blood work, the results will be better than last time. The pills are Enteric coated, which is great. Though I do experience fish burps from time to time, it isn't severe. I will say that the first 2-3 days, it did cause some stomach discomfort but that subsided. The bottle does state that for people in my situation, it is recommended to take 1 capsule 3 times each day. I am going to continue taking the OmegaVia and GNC fish oil until the GNC brand is gone and will up my dosage of the OmegaVia if my blood work does show improvement. I will reply to this review with a follow up once I get the results of my bloodwork.

title: Excellent Marketing, Inferior Absorption Form, Look elsewhere...again EXCELLENT MARKETING
body: FOR ALL PEOPLE NEW TO FISH OIL, PLEASE LISTEN. OmegaVia has a very aggressive, blog-like marketing team pushing this product on the Internet. If one searches "enteric coated fish oil" on Google, their website is the first to come up, listing all the benefits of enteric-coated fish oil, naturally. In fact, just searching any number of questions regarding fish oil will bring up Vin Kutty's blog on omegavia.com (the owner, always a bad sign). The "health blog" is just strangely written, vacillating between product placement and shooing contrary evidence (e.g. about the bioavailibliy of different forms of fish oil) under the rug. Check it out yourself. Enteric coating is almost certainly unnecessary for the absorption of fish oil in the human body (Lovaza, the actual fish oil-based pharmaceutical drug used for lowering triglycerides, is not even enteric coated!) save for a few potential exotic applications such as Crohn's Disease (and even these have marginal benefits). Do not be hoodwinked by marketing. It should be clear this is NOT the triglyceride form of fish oil, the most bioavailible form. This is the ethyl-ester (EE) form, a semi-synthetic form which is easier to manufacture (interestingly, it's the active ingredient in Lovaza as well, which raises all sorts of questions the FDA might be interested in investigating). DO NOT BE FOOLED BY THE PROFESSED HIGHER AMOUNTS OF EPA AND DHA. While technically yes there are higher "amounts," this specific form (EE) is more poorly available to the body. This isn't intended to be a product plug, but most of Nordic Natural's stuff is triglyceride form, the primary reason they're so expensive. Bottom line: Don't waste your time with this stuff. They have excellent marketing, but the product is overpriced, less effective than the triglyceride form, and questionably legal due to their addition of an active pharmaceutical ingredient in accordance to the FDA's Dietary Supplement Health and Education Act of 1994 (DSHEA).

title: Great product and transparency.  Owner very helpful and details provided for the product.  One of best bio engineered products.
body: Example on how to sell omega-3 acid triglycerides dietary supplements.  Other manufactures should use this as a model to win customers and produce a high quality product.  Someone who knows their product. Great blister pack and I did not get any fish burps with the lemon coated capsules that are made of fish gelatin.  Look at the information given such as fatty acid profile and country of origin is on the box.  Many other omega-3 acid dietary supplements claim "Made in USA" even though they may come from China.  The only issue I have with the product is the residual ethyl esters and the breakdown of the amount of DAGs, MAGs, and TAGs in the product. It would be nice to show what the specifications are for these molecules remaining after the enzymatic esterification between ethyl esters and glycerol.  It would be great if the product could be made into an emulsion for even better absorption. Please not that this is a synthetic product but the molecules are "nature identical" to what you would get if you ate oily fish.  Only difference is that their are higher concentrations of TAGs where all three positions on the glycerol backbone are occupied by all EPA, all DHA, and some combinations of the two with other fatty acids.

title: Good, But Pricey. There Is A Way To Get It Cheaper!
body: Most people would benefit from Omega 3, but there are certain medical conditions that definitely benefit from taking it.  I developed dry eye syndrome. for which palliative treatments exist, but no cure.  My eye doctor recommended upping my daily Omega 3 to 3g which helps the condition, but warned it would take at least a year before results would be noticeable.  In researching Omega 3 supplements online, I found that the majority of Omega 3 products sold - in stores and online - simply did not provide enough EPA and DHA, regardless of the overall "strength" of the dose they provided.  Unfortunately you can be taking most of those products without getting the real benefit.  While it's not always true, you usually do get what you pay for.  Cheaper Omega 3 supplements are cheaper for a reason - and it's not a good reason!  That's why I switched to Omax 3.

I think it compares very favorably to some of the more expensive brands I've used in the past and will probably keep taking it.

title: One of the best on the market
body: Some studies show an Omega 3 deficiency can be a significant factor in both mental and physical health and I believe it! I've been taking this for several years and feel certain it has had a positive impact on my health. My cholesterol levels are perfect. My blood pressure isn't perfect but much better than it was. I used to have extremely dry eyes and I've noticed an overall improvement in hydration. As I age I hope this product will help with brain, cancer and eye health as well. If there's even a slight chance that it will, I'm all in! I have no trouble swallowing the softgel capsules tho they are rather large. I've had no fishy taste, after-taste or burping.

title: Buyers be ware, this brand makes supplement of questionable ...
body: Buyers be ware, this brand makes supplement of questionable quality that is harmful to health. The fish oil we purchased smell rancid when opened. Both my husband and myself got stomach pain and diarrhea after consuming it. The company refused to address this issue because it is "outside 3 month sales date window" but the product does not expire for two more years!!!! When unsaturated fatty acid (omega-3 such as EPA and DHA) is converted into an oxidant, fatty acid’s metabolic intermediates—such as malondialdehyde (MDA) & 4-hydroxy-2-nonenal—also become pro-oxidative species. The oxidation products then lead to cell death by compromising cellular membrane integrity or by damaging other proteins, lipids, or DNA. It is safer for your health to buy quality product from a more reputable company that actually cares about their products showing rancid smell (pungent odor indicates a severe degree of oxidation) and cause GI problems for their customers.

title: One of the best higher concentrated fish oil gel caps I've found - no fishy burpy taste!
body: The Simply Right brand is distributed by Sam's Club.  However, my local Sam's Club stopped carrying these for some reason, so I was very relieved to find them available on Amazon.  I sure hope they are not discontinued, as this particular fish oil cap has one of the highest concentrations of omega 3's in 1 gel cap, at a good price that I found! I'm all for taking 1 pill whenever I can!  While research debates whether you should split up your omega 3's throughout the day versus taking all at once, I'm not very good at taking multiple doses.  It's got to be once or not at all! If you can handle swallowing what capsule size standards consider large - the gel cap measures 1 inch, then you got to try this one.  In one gel cap, you get 1400 mg of fish oil, but more importantly, it's the amount of Omega 3's in each pill that counts.  The higher the concentration level, the less fish oil you need to consume. This one contains 900 mg of Omega 3's, which is made up of 647 mg of EPA and 253 mg of DHA.  This is a concentration level of 64% (900/1400) which is ranked as a high concentration by ConsumerLab.com (very high being 65 - 79%).  Most other fish oil pills  require you to take 2 or 3 similar size pills to get the same amount of Omega 3's.  As noted on the label, 1 gel cap gives you triple the strength and is recommended for sedentary adults who do not consume fish on a weekly basis or are concerned with high blood pressure.  Again the research I've done conflicts on this, some saying 500 mg of Omega 3 is enough, others saying the average adult needs more like 900 - 1000 Omega 3's daily particularly if you have health concerns such as high blood pressure or high cholesterol. I have both being treated with medication, but my doctor also advised taking a supplement since I don't eat fish regularly enough. I just started taking fish oil 3 months ago and haven't seen my doctor yet to see any measureable changes, but I feel great and I know there are many more benefits in consuming Omega 3's. This brand also uses an enteric capsule, which means it is designed to protect the soft gel from releasing the fish oil until it reaches the small intestine - hence no fishy burps!  In a 2015 updated review by ConsumerLab they approved this supplement in containing the amounts of EPA and DHA as claimed on their label, and passed the purity tests for lead and mercury. It also carries the USP verified symbol on its label.  There is a lot of information out there about fish oils, what to look for, what concentration is best, whether more EPA or DHA is better, etc. Fish oil supplements are by no means created equal.  Do your research, read the labels and know what you're getting.  Price is not an indicator, neither is the brand name.  As far as buying a fresh product online, the product I received last week had an expiration date of June 2016 and it was made in Canada. I certainly hope this product will continue to be available, and that Sam's Club carries it again.

title: Price is right.
body: Great price and is clinically proven to control fishy burps. (It really does control them for me I hardly have an issue) Is it effective? Who the heck knows. We can only assume they are giving us what we purchased. I think they are but (shrug of shoulders) Does it help with cardiovascular health as promoted in the label? I guess I will tell you 40 years or so. Who knows. But if you have decided to use fish oil I don't see any reason not to buy this product. One warning the capsules are BIG. If you have an overactive gag reflex you may not be able to use.

title: Omega 3 Supreme Strength by Life and Food are great
body: The Omega 3 Supreme Strength by Life and Food are more football shaped and about 3/4 the size of the normal Fish Oil supplement. So consequently they are easier to swallow. I have no burps with it. My husband has fewer fish burps than with the regular. I have read that Omega 3 is more concentrated than fish oil caps. In reading some of the other reviews, I noticed they said the pills were hard to swallow. They must really have problems with fish oil. One also said the pills were hard - the review must have been on a different pill.

title: Life & Food -- Perfect Omega-3 Supplement
body: I have been looking for Omega 3 for some time - have purchased others in the past and have not been that impressed, plus I worry about absorption  and seem to have issues with burping at times...which is uncomfortable and fishy tasting. After exhaustive research I identified Life & Food's Omega-3 Supreme and liked what I read in the reviews as well as the dosage size. I appreciate the care they take in their fishing and manufacturing processes as it is extremely important for quality and purity not to mention environmental issues as well.

title: Can't beat it for Omega-3 Quality & Cost per 1000mg!!
body: I really love these fish oil capsules, and I will be a loyal user as long as the formula doesn't change (and pricing remains competitive, of course).  I am a big believer in Omega-3's and was looking to take upwards of ~2000mg per day. I have multiple degrees, one in the sciences, but I am certainly no M.D., so don't follow my example on dosage without doing proper research and getting educated assistance.  But my point is, when you want to get 1800-2000mg in a day, fish oil caps become VERY expensive very quickly.  However after I crunched all the numbers, these pills won in cost-effectiveness against all the other brands when factoring in QUALITY of the oils along with cost per 1000mg Omega-3. In fact the only other company to compete was the Sams Club variety.  However the Life & Food brand edged them out because they contain a bit more O3's per serving :) I have been using them for 3 months now and I'm very happy! 1 serving first thing in the morning and one serving in the evening.  I also keep them in the fridge to ensure they stay as fresh as possible. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

title: high quality and easy to swallow pill

title: Anti-depressant withdrawl symptoms
body: This product is the best.  I read that it would help with the side effects related to SSRI (anti-depressant) withdrawl so I decided to give it a try.  After taking Zoloft for 30 years, with many failed attempts to stop taking it, I finally was able to do it with the help of Omega-3 Supreme!  I still experienced many of the symptoms (like brain zaps, sadness, etc) but much milder than before.  I really noticed a difference after taking 2 capsules every time the symptoms started up again.  On the very worst days I took 2 morning, noon and night.  I spent 3 months tapering until i was done. Now I am free of symptoms but will continue to take Omega-3 Supreme 1x daily to keep my brain/body in good shape.  I was skeptical that this would really work but it did!  Thank you for making it easier to get off anti-depressants.  I really don't think I could have done it without this product.

title: Great product for a great price.
body: My doctor advises me to take 2-4 g of fish oil daily.  However, that amount of quality fish oil would break the bank.  I ordered the Omega-3 supreme and received it a few days ago.  The pills are relatively small compared to the kind I was using before, which I welcomed.  I have no fish burps, which I did with the last brand, even though it was supposed to be burp free.  I use two servings per day... but this bottle will still last me 45 days that rate and for a great price.  I'm glad I switched to this product.

title: Life & Food Inc., Omega-3 Supreme Suppliment

body: No fish burps, no smell to them at all.  I was buying my fish triple strength fish oil from Walmart, but since I'd rather order from my home, I tried out this brand.  It has worked out much better than other brand.  There are literally zero burps with this product, and I continue to have painless joints.  I will be buying again.

title: Enteric coated!!!  ONE pill a day.....NOT two or three!!!!
body: First and foremost.  I received a free bottle of this product today for writing an honest review.  I am so impressed with this product I went ahead and ordered another bottle which I paid for as you can see....... Amazon Verified Purchase.

title: Great for Early Recovery
body: I am a recovering alcoholic. I started taking these Omega 3 Fish Oil pills during early recovery based on the advice of a friend who said that they would help me to 'reknit the neural networks' that I had damaged over 20 years of heavy drinking. I have been taking one a day religiously for one year.

title: Great product!
body: Small but potent and very easy to swallow. Have bought another bottle and will continue to use Omega 3 Supreme Strength.

title: What An Amazing Product!!!
body: I ordered this product about a month ago. I have taken it faithfully every day at one twice a day.  I purchased it for my heart. Not only has it helped my heart tremendously, but it did something that I was not expecting. I have alopecia. I lost my hair in the top due to being on hypertension medicine for over 14 years. I have had to wear a wig for a long time. One day, while reading a book, I shifted position and rested my head in the palm of my hand. I begin rubbing it when I felt a thickness there. I was like wow, could this be the Omega 3?  I then googled it and discovered that Omega 3s are indeed very good to take for hair grow. Moreover, I do not wake up with morning stiffness anymore. When you're 50 years old, this is one benefit that you greatly appreciate, especially if you were in a car accident that caused a injury to your C3.

title: So far, so good.
body: I have used other Omega 3 products from different suppliers in the past (all with lower EPA/DNA concentrations). Since using this product for a month or so,  I haven't noticed much difference,  with the exception of fewer burps and less fishy taste.

title: I bought this for two uses
body: I originally got this product for my dogs because my vet wanted me to get a supplement for their coat. Once I got the product I decided to  try them out for myself. They really help me be able to focus better during the day and also they help my dogs coat to be healthier. So I will recommend this to anyone that needs a supplement to help their focus during the day.

title: Great fish oil for your health!
body: I have been wanting to take fish oil for some time, but I wanted to take quality Fish oil. I have been doing my research and when looking into this I found that there were a few things that were important for me. First, was that it would have high quality amount of Omega 3 oil. Second, I wanted a pill that was small in size and easy to swallow. Third, I wanted a non-GMO product that would not make me smelling like a fish. As I was looking I found this product and it really fit all of my criteria. I have been trying this for the past week and have been very impressed with the overall experience. title: No Fish Burps!
body: When I was growing up in the 1970's, my mother gave me a teaspoonful of cod liver oil every day. I hated it! No matter what I'd eaten, I'd have horrible fishy burps all day long. As an adult, I read a lot about the benefits of Omega 3 Fish Oil but I was ruined by the memory of those ghastly belches. I'm getting close to the big 5-0 now, though, and I'm much more aware of products that will help me stay healthy. A friend and I were talking about Omega-3 Fish Oil being one of the healthiest supplements you can take and I told her the cod liver oil story. She went to her kitchen cabinet and took out a bottle of Life & Food Omega-3 Fish Oil and swore - really promised - that I wouldn't have any problem with their product. She took a dozen capsules out of the bottle and gave them to me to take home. Honestly? I almost threw them out but my better side stuck a capsule in my mouth and I nervously swallowed. I waited for that familiar fishy taste but it never came. I've been using Life & Food Omega-3 Fish Oil now for three months and I have never - not once - had a "fish burp." Hallelujah! My mom's not around anymore but she would be so proud of me! I also love the fact that there is a 90 day supply in each bottle. At Life & Food's price, that's a real bargain. I highly recommend this product. Start young! It's hard to play catch-up when it comes to your health.

I took it once a day with breakfast for the past two weeks. my focus has improved at work, I can remember detailed numerical lists much better, and I'm quite a bit happier around the office. I think the mood boost is from the fish oil itself and also because it feels great to have a better memory and concentration. In short, I'd recommend it to anyone who doesn't have daily access to oily fish and has problems with depression or memory, because Omega 3's are so important for maintaining good health.

title: No burps! Arthritis gone!
body: Doctor ordered me to take fish oil for high triglycerides. Was dreading it because all others that I have tried produced disgusting burps/diarrhea. These taste great, go down easy, no burps or stomach upset. As an added bonus, after one week of taking them, my arthritis has disappeared. I take as directed, 2 pills, 3 times a day, with a meal. Thank God for these miracle pills!

title: Dr. Tobias Omega 3 Fish Oil lives up to its promises!
body: We switched to Dr. Tobias when the Omega 3 brand we had been purchasing became unavailable. Frankly, I wasn't too impressed with the previous brand. My wife said she felt some benefit, but I experienced no improvement. After a few weeks using Dr. Tobias Omega 3 Fish Oil, I am pleased to report a marked improvement in my knees. I am able to walk with much less pain and difficulty, and I only occasionally need my cane! I look forward to further improvement as we continue to use this product. It is so nice to find a "miracle" product that lives up to its promises!

title: Omega 3
body: I've been take Omega 3 for quite a while now. Just recently my eye doctor recommended finding an Omega 3 with at least this amount of 800mg EPA and  600mg DHA.  I'm taking this for my dry eyes. So far, along with the eye drops and this product my eyes don't feel like I have sand in them. They don't have a fishy taste or an after taste. I would recommend them.

title: I purchased Dr Tobias Omega 3 fish oil to help ...
body: I purchased Dr Tobias Omega 3 fish oil to help me with my high cholesterol, but I found it helped my arthritis even more.  I was daily taking aleve four times a day and was still in pain, after taking Dr Tobias Omega 3, I actually woke up without pain in my knees. I haven't gotten my bloodwork back yet to see if my cholesterol has improved, but waking up without knee pain will keep me taking the supplements.

title: No more pain
body: I have a autoimmune disease. I was suspect with taking this product but after reading all the good reviews, I figured it wouldn't  hurt to give it a try. It's a little pricey  but being painless is priceless in my world. I only take it once a day and it works wonders. I dont wake up with joint pain or walk around during the day with pain. I've been taking this for about 5-6 months now. I don't go a night with out taking a pill. I like the fact it doesn't have a fishy after taste. Great product. I definitely recommend you give it a try!

title: They're pretty darn close
body: Okay, so I've taken a lot of fish oil over the years. The claim on this one, "burp-free" had me interested, so I ordered a bottle. They're pretty darn close, actually, and I'm impressed. Where a LOT of fish oil caplets have you burping up what tastes  like rancid haddock every five minutes, this one has a very light, very small burp maybe once or twice throughout the day. As far as it goes, I'm happy - it's not completely burp-free, but it's darn close.

body: I'm on a therapeutic dose of EPA (medium chain Omega 3s) based on the recommendation of The Depression Cure (highly recommended). I'm about 3 weeks in and feel great. Thank you for a great product!

body: My husband and I were taking just one gel cap each evening with dinner because it was supposed to be good for you. When we finished the second bottle, I neglected to re-order and was surprised to realize that my little one-cap dosage had quietly kept my recurring hip bursitis at bay. When the pain came roaring back, I re-ordered and the bursitis was quiet by the second day. Just ordered a bottle for my 96 year old mom who suffers from spinal stenosis. I'll edit this review to reflect her experience in a few days.

His findings showed that the tribe members had almost no history of depression or any depression like symptoms - and he placed diet as primary importance for the lack of depression.

I feel very happy with the results of my last cholesterol test, from 920 in triglycerides to now 245 within the first month. I will continue the use now that I see the big difference with adding this supplement to my diet by continuing my daily dose of two pills. Pills have a strong fish smell, but no fishy after taste.

title: Great fish oil supplement!
body: I'm giving this supplement 5 stars on a "so far so good!" basis, as it's hard to judge a supplement with less than a month's use. But having tried several other fish oil products, I'm delighted with this one. The tablets are large (as all fish oils are), yet shaped so that they're not hard (for me) to swallow and have a nice smooth coating on them. There is absolutely NO fish oil smell or aftertaste. After the first week, I've noticed a definite improvement in my dry eyes... don't have to use drops as often. Waiting for other improvements related to fish oil to follow. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this fine product and will continue to purchase. Thank gosh, after trying so many & choking or being turned off by the smell.

title: great supplement
body: I have been taking these for a week to help with dry eye and it does appear to be working. I started off with just 1 a day but am now taking 1 at lunch and 1 with dinner. I think I have only used my eye drops once since I started taking them and have noticed much better sleep. If I wake up at all I seem to easily fall back to sleep which is a nice benefit. I have also noticed a slight decrease in appetite and have been able to work out a little more due to some increased energy. I have given a weeks worth now to my mom to try for her arthritis and will update after her trial. These are my first venture into fish oil supplements but they do not upset my stomach at all nor cause the fishy burpsI have heard other supplements apparently do.

title: Excellent Quality
body: While I cannot claim that this product has cured any diseases, I can say that I do feel markedly better after adding this supplement to my diet. True to the claim, the capsules are easy to handle and swallow, and remarkably free of any fishy taste or smell. A quality product all around!

title: Easy On My Tummy
body: I may give this product another star after I have used it longer, but it is a recent purchase. When I open the jar and sniff carefully, it is almost odorless - but there is an extremely faint fresh smell; with absolutely NO "fishy" aspect to it. I am healing leaky gut and my system is hyper-sensitive to any supplement or vitamin, but this has never caused a problem, even on an empty stomach or when I didn't feel well. No fishy burps or smelly urine, which I have experienced with some other fish oil products.

title: These fish oil pills are the best out. They are easy to swallow
body: These fish oil pills are the best out. They are easy to swallow. The best part is with my experience of other fish oil pills is that these do not leave a nasty fishy taste. Even when I burp later I do not get that nasty taste. Ever since I've taken these pills I have noticed more energy, better skin and hair, and a somewhat easier mind state to focus. Fast shipping as well.

title: Great product

When I first got the pills I was questioning the capsules big time and in doing so I accidentally broke a one testing the desensity. Out of curiosity I placed the broken cap into a glass of Bragg's ACV and some lemon juice not sure of the exact stomach acid level to see how long these caps took to digest. After 3 day the cap was still pretty in tact. I just image these pills building up and clogging my insides. I continue to take them because of the price I paid. And still no effect negative or positive I can't say the recent brain fog is an effect of these so I won't. I wouldn't purchase these again. I guess it's back to Barleans. Also while its a plus that there's no fishy aftertaste the actual capsule taste nasty :/

title: Trustworthy source of fish oil with high EPA/DHA
body: While it is impossible on a day-to-day basis to establish that one high-quality fish oil pill outweighs another, I appreciate the high EPA/DHA content (2,000mg) of Dr. Tobias's pills. Look at a bottle from CVS or most other vendors and you would have to take three to six pills to get that amount of the critical ingredients. In my opinion (and I have worked on fish and health issues), an adult without additional needs can take one pill per day. I also appreciate that it is made in the USA and is third-party tested. The last point is especially important, since fisheries used as inputs to all fish oil pills are not all domestic.

title: Cheap doesn't necessarily mean better...
body: I'm trying to be more educated in buying fish oil pills.  Based upon my reading, fish oil pills should NOT have ANY fishy taste.  Try biting into a Dr. Tobias fish oil pill and let some of the oil coat your tongue.  You'll taste a mild "fishy" taste.  From what I've read, any fishy odor/taste indicates oxidation (spoilage).  Oxidation destroys the omega-3 fatty acids.  Hence you lose the healthful benefit of the fish oil pill.  Also, I read that fish oil capsules should be "clear" (like those clear shiny golden vitamin E or D capsules you buy).  I purchased this product twice, and both times the capsules have this "hazy"  semi-clear quality.  I compared this to another brand, which is perfectly clear ( and odorless as well ).  So while I like the quantity of EPA and DHA. in the Dr. Tobias capsules... what good is it if the main ingredient is damaged and potentially worthless?  I am going to switch to a more expensive (unfortunately) brand that I have confidence in.  Dr. Tobias fish oil would be a "steal" if the quality of the product was what it should be.

title: Contains soy. Deal breaker.
body: Contains soy. So it's a deal breaker for me. Also the gelatin is made from bovine (cow) and I only eat meat RARELY and only from grass fed organic sources. This could be adding to your toxic load of xeno estrogens just FYI, and we get enough of those everywhere. Don't need a supplement to add to the load. I should have checked the label with more scrutiny before I bought and took a bunch of them. "Natural Vitamin E" is almost nearly soy based in supps. Just beware. Everything I read about fish oil products in my research these days is that it has a high incidence of rancidity. I'll just eat the fish when I can. And leave these supplements out of my diet when I feel they'll do more harm than good. Always remember that these are NOT approved by the FDA nor are they regulated in any way. Buyer beware.

As a skeptic about most things, I was not prepared for this to work so well. My average SYSTOLIC blood pressure was around 160-plus, and my diastolic number was around 90-plus. I just turned 61, and was very concerned about my top number being so high. I have taken this supplement exactly three days. Today my top number was 121 and my bottom number was 82. I have NOT had numbers like this since the 1990's. I have taken a double dose of high BP meds and a statin drug for my cholesterol for 18 months, and the numbers were STILL OUT OF CONTROL. I am no longer a skeptic. Everyone should be taking this supplement. It truly works!!

I then started taking Nature Made Fish oil and Kirkland Fish oil.  However, I don't see any result and my pain still linger.  A few days ago, I just noticed I could move my elbow freely because the pain is gone.  The only different is that I have been taking this fish oil since 5 weeks ago.  I am extremely pleased with this fish oil and hope that other customers will give it a try.  Please be patient, unlike drug it might take times to build up in one's system. title: Give it a shot!
body: I purchased this around a month ago. I had read alot of the reviews, and saw numerous people had received a free bottle, so I called for one as well, after I had started taking the bottle I bought, but that in no way, shape, or form influenced my review. I purchased this for a few reasons, one being my bloodwork is great but my good cholesterol is a little low. Another is that my joints have been stiff, and I heard fish oil was good for that. So I ordered a bottle. Shipped incredibly fast, and custormer service is top notch, with emails promptly replied to, and I actually felt they cared about my health. I'm just about 50, have been weight training, powerlifting, etc since i was a teenager, and a couple yrs ago, threw in some crossfit for good measure. I have taken this religiously, first thing in the am, and have an alarm set to take it again around 5 pm. I keep the bottle in the fridge, have noticed NO fish odor, fish burps, etc. Capsules are large, but very easy to swallow. I should also add that I added Dr Tobias hip knee and joint, along with some Flar-FX, a couple weeks ago. And I'm pleased to say I can definitely feel a difference. Body overall feels better, and knees are alot less stiff. I won't know about the bloodwork till next year, but anticipate great results there as well. As I mentioned, I DID receive a free bottle, but I wanted to write a straightforward, no BS review, and make it clear that I would give 5 stars without the free bottle.

title: High quality fish oil!
body: I'm a family physician and an avid runner.  I take fish oil because it is a great alternative way to reduce joint pain.  It's also important in our brains and helps keep blood triglyceride levels low.  Many fish oil products use rancid oils and this is evidenced by the dreaded "fishy burp."  This is a high quality product and very effective for my purposes since it helps with my knee pain and keeps me from having to be a regular NSAID user.

title: Taking Optimum Omega Fish Oil for Depression
body: I have been taking Dr. Tobia's Optimum Omega 3 Fish Oil Pills for 2 weeks now. They do not have any flavor whatsoever when I take them. I take 3 per day to get the amount of EPA/DHA required to prevent depression as recommended by the book, "The Depression Cure". I have noticed that my hair is shinier already and my skin is staying very clear (I suffer from acne). I do have a little more energy than I had before, but am not sure whether it is due to taking these fish oil pills. I just finished weaning myself off of my Zoloft antidepressant two weeks ago when I began taking the fish oil. I am also using light therapy equivalent to 10,000 LUX most days, so the increase in energy could also be the result of this or the combination of light therapy and fish oil. It is too soon to say all the benefits of the fish oil, however, this brand was one of the most affordable I could find online of its quality. I have noticed a few fish burps when I take it in the morning, so I started taking the fish oil at night and that solved this. I will have to update my post after taking it for a few months. I have to allow my brain chemistry to return back to normal without taking antidepressants to see if this fish oil really helps as scientists and physicians claim. I will let you know.

title: The best part is the product
body: I have purchased 3 bottles of the Dr Tobias Fish Oil Capsules through Amazon over the past year. Each time I place an order I immediately receive an email from the manufacturer following up with the purchase. In addition, the product arrives when promised. The best part is the product. I have tried many fish oil capsules in the past, however the Dr. Tobias Fish Oil capsules are the first I have found that are truly burpless. The next time I ordered Dr. Tobias's, same thing, and the next time and the next time.  How do you get 5000 customer reviews for a fish oil product?  You ask them, politely, but repeatedly to review their product. Besides this fish oil, I take several other natural supplements (namely, turmeric) in lieu of NSAIDs that offer the same benefits fish oil does, so it's not easy to suss out what is — or isn't — working.

title: Lack of Quality Control!! Some capsules leaking fish oil in the two bottles I bought.
body: Lack of Quality Control!!  I am a vegetarian and to put it mildly, my palate almost revolts when I tried Salmon prepared in the best way even with Thai Curry.  However, I have been asked to eat fish or fish oil to reduce my LDL.  So far, I have been eating a lemon flavor burp free fish oil capsules from one of the competitor's.  They are excellent and almost equal in EPA & DHA, but found them rather expensive.  Then I came across Dr. Tobias fish oil,  the EPA & DHA seemed a little bit higher in this and the price was cheaper.  So I figured, I will give this a try.  The first month I took them, no complaints, then suddenly I started feeling the fish oil in my mouth when I swallowed them.  Then, yesterday, I put the fish oil along with my other meds and left them in my pill dispenser. When I took it out in the night, I noticed bubbles inside the fish oil capsule. It was leaking and it had given a good coating of oil on my other meds also. I checked another bottle of the two I had bought and found that also seemed to have couple capsules that were leaking.  I discarded the two bottles and now have to go and my usual rather expensive alternate one.  I wished they would check and make sure that their manufactured capsules are not leaking.

Though i cannot yet testify as to the benefits of this particular product, it has been clearly established that Omega 3 is an important nutrient that most of us don't get a sufficient amount of in our regular diets.  These are a medium-large capsule, but very easy to swallow (i take x2 at once).  No fishy smell, but one day i did get burps (from something else i ate) and was able to THEN smell the fish.  Was not a problem, just a little funny.  I intend to continue taking these daily.

I'll trust the science that omega-3's are important and after doing research, these seemed among the best. More expensive than some brands but realized it's only the EPA and BHA that matter, and that's what the focus is here, why pay for filler? Also happy to report that I've taken with food, without food, at bedtime and at lunch, and never noticed any kind of fishy taste, or taste whatsoever. Also very easy to swallow. I'm happy.

title: Bitter capsule

title: Great product, until several pills broke and ruined the rest of the bottle.
body: I purchased these fish oil pills about 3 months ago. They were great at first--no taste whatsoever. However, a few weeks ago I noticed a fishy smell starting to emanate from the open bottle and a bit of oily residue on the pills themselves. This, understandably, has changed the taste from "no problem whatsoever" to "oh-this-is-disgusting" very quickly. I emptied the bottle into a sieve this morning to try and dry off the excess oil and found a clump of pills stuck to each other in the bottom of the bottle as well as three cracked pills leaking oil into the bottle. The container has been sitting undisturbed on a counter since I bought it, so no chance of this being caused by a random drop or roll down a giant hill. I am actually pretty disappointed, as these are convenient and come highly reviewed. Definitely not worth the cost when I lose half a bottle to pill leakage, though.

title: Just started using and I love that there is absolutely no fishy aftertaste
body: Just started using and I love that there is absolutely no fishy aftertaste. I recommend taking after your largest meal of the day if you are prone to getting nauseous like I am. I took after a light breakfast and was nauseous for about an hour. Now I take after dinner and I don't have any issues.

title: Wait and See!
body: Just started taking Dr. Tobias Fish Oil after receiving the "news" from my doctor about a long over due lipid panel - not awful, but certainly could be better.  My "bad" cholesterol had gone up with my age. So what else is new?  I also have a fair amount of stiffness too and after reading enough sources on the Internet, there appears to be some evidence that older people (that's me!) lack omega 3's and these fatty acids MAY help reduce inflammation and improve ones heart health.  Two for the price of one!!  There also does not appear to be a downside in taking modest amounts (now too  much of a good thing can also be a problem) of fish oil as long as the sources of the oil do not come from fish that are known to be contaminated with heavy metals like mercury.  In that regard, Dr. Tobias appears to have done his research - small fish and salmon are not on the list for now.  Like other reviewers have stated, I don't burp this fish oil.  I have added Nature's Made Cholest Off which has excellent reviews for reducing "bad" cholesterol and I imagine that one should not take both of these supplements at the same meal - the Cholest Off might prevent the absorption of the fish oil.  Other than that, my skin already is softer and time will tell whether my blood panel has improved.

I still feel it's a little early to notice a huge difference from the pills but so far I'm very pleased and plan to stick with them.

This was when I found the Dr. Tobias brand, and all I can say is that they've delivered in bringing us a dependable, efficient form of essential fatty acids. Even when broken open, the smell is rather mild, whether it's due to the compound or what I don't know but it sure does the trick.

title: Lack of Quality Control!! Some capsules leaking fish oil in the two bottles I bought.

However, I have been asked to eat fish or fish oil to reduce my LDL.  So far, I have been eating a lemon flavor burp free fish oil capsules from one of the competitor's.  They are excellent and almost equal in EPA & DHA, but found them rather expensive.  Then I came across Dr. Tobias fish oil,  the EPA & DHA seemed a little bit higher in this and the price was cheaper.  So I figured, I will give this a try.  The first month I took them, no complaints, then suddenly I started feeling the fish oil in my mouth when I swallowed them.  Then, yesterday, I put the fish oil along with my other meds and left them in my pill dispenser. When I took it out in the night, I noticed bubbles inside the fish oil capsule. It was leaking and it had given a good coating of oil on my other meds also. I checked another bottle of the two I had bought and found that also seemed to have couple capsules that were leaking.  I discarded the two bottles and now have to go and my usual rather expensive alternate one.  I wished they would check and make sure that their manufactured capsules are not leaking.

My conclusion is that it is the fish oil that has been the primary factor to bring down my triglycerides level.

What I loved about this particular brand, besides the nutrient profile, was the fact that I never once got the nasty fish burps that I experienced with most of the previous brands I tried. I plan to call the manufacturer and ask about the cause of the problem, but the last two bottles I received were filled with capsules which were covered in a light coating of oil, making my hands messy and leaving a really bad taste in my mouth each time I consumed them. And then regardless of whether I ate and/or drank before or after, these latest capsules give me the fish burps every time. It's too bad because I'm going to have to switch my Amazon subscription to the brand I used before, Nordic Naturals, which are great but a bit more expensive.

title: Noticeable reduction in joint pain since I started taking this product!
body: I've taken other Omega 3 formulations in the past, but none of them compare to the success I've achieved in joint pain reduction that I've discovered since using Dr. Tobias Triple Strength Omega-3 Fish Oil.  My knees and hips are prone to nearly unbearable bouts of pain at times, but after taking two Dr. Tobias capsules each morning with my breakfast, I have noticed a considerable decrease in pain in my joints.  My hip pain was greater than my knee pain in the past, but now I rarely have the frequency of hip pain flare ups.  My knee pain still tends to flare up with standing and walking, but the intensity of my knee pain has definitely been alleviated.  I just had blood work to test my cholesterol levels for the first time since taking this and I'm looking forward to seeing how my levels have been impacted from Dr. Tobias fish oil.  I'll try to remember to update this with my results after I see my doctor later this week.

title: It works great for people with Reynaud's disease!
body: I have suffered from Reynaud's disease for a long time and for the past two years was taking a blood pressure lowering med (nifedipine) to help in the winter months. After I ran out of nifedipine I started reading about natural ways of stopping Reynaud's attacks. I had tried Ginkgo Biloba before, but didn't like the way it made the blood rush to my hands/feet/face...it felt like I was burning. I decided to try omega 3 fish pills after reading studies that in some people, this supplement helped with Reynauds. I have been taking these pills for several weeks now and they work very well, as well as the nifedipine, and although my hands get cold, I have noticed a dramatic decrease in the number of Reynaud's attacks. I will definitely continue taking these during the winter months.

body: I recently had a physical with my doctor and was told that I needed to seriously consider using an Omega 3 supplement.  He tried to get me to sign up for a sponsored supplement that a doctor recommendation was required.  I asked for a brochure of the product so that I could research on my own if I could get the same ingredients in and open market environment.  That is where I found Dr. Tobias formula on Amazon.  It is one of the few Omega 3 formulas that has the recommended EPA/DHA dosage that met the doctor=sponsored requirements at a much better price point.  I have been taking this supplement consistently for about 3 weeks now and all is well.  No fishy odor or aftertaste present at all.  I will await my next blood test to evaluate the benefit of the supplement, but I have noticed some better skin conditioning that I actually was not expecting.

title: A Miracle Pain Relief Supplement...
body: I have only been using this Fish Oil by Dr. Tobias for three weeks now but have seen a noticeable improvement-mostly in the pain filled areas of my body. You see, I am disabled and have many pains on a scale of 1-10 well 100, that's how excruciating the pain is. Recently, I had a bad fall and severely hurt my right arm, had a fracture there and a sprain that hurt like nobody's business. I remember hearing about how a good quality fish oil could help reduce severe pain. Well, from the first dosage, I recognized mobility coming back into the arm. Since then, I have been taking the fish oil, mind you in large amounts (3) at a time because I also heard that for pain, omegas were to be taken in large amounts. I just know it is these omegas that are reducing the pain to almost nothing, as if the injury almost didn't occur-it's still there in other words but so much less. Thank you Dr.Tobias for these miracle omega supplements, I will be taking them for all my pain needs which are massive...I know these will reduce the inflammation. Also, my skin looks more dewy, not so dry. These are truly a must have on my list of supplements!

title: Poor baby fishes.

They're not cute though so I guess it balances out.

title: No compromises between quality and affordability here!
body: I've tried out many different brands of fish oil over the past few years. My criteria for choosing being some compromise between quality and price, because some of the best brands can get quite expensive! The last brand I had was actually a gift of a good one that I couldn't bring myself to pay regularly for. (Something like $40/bottle 200count) When I ran out, I went looking for something with similar levels of EPA/DHA, molecular distillation to get rid of mercury and any other unsavories, hopefully a good coating to help prevent fish burps, good reviews, and a reasonable price. Dr. Tobias met each of my needs. I don't know if it's the "best" brand on the market, but it's got to be the best at this price point. My whole family uses it. And I never get a fishy taste, which I would sometimes get even with pills claiming to have enteric coating. The company is nice and seems to care for their customers.

title: No Wow Factors, Two Pills causes acne, stick to one pill a day
body: So far it's not horrible. It doesn't cause me to burp any fishy oils, the pill size is on average for fish oil, and the pills don't smell bad as long as they are not cracked. I haven't noticed major differences in my mental capacity or metabolism. When I started taking the supplement, I only took one pill a day to become more acquainted physically with the levels. (Recommended Dose = 2/day). After a week, I increased my dose to two pills a day as recommended; however, I will be decreasing it back to 1 per day as I have begun to break out with acne across my face, chest, and back. I did become drowsy at first when I started the two pills at a time but that could be contributed to a number of factors. My original purpose for taking the fish oil was for my finger nails and hair. I have very brittle nails that break and flake fairly easy. Several of my friends who had similar issues said this went away once they started supplementing with Fish oils. I will update the effects on my nails once they have grown out longer in a few months.

title: Shoulder and knee pain GONE.
body: I have been suffering from chronic pain for well over a year.  Both shoulders,  my right elbow,  and both knees.  I haven't been able to sleep a full night without waking up tossing and turning cause my shoulders hurt terribly.  My husband nagged me for a few months to try this stuff,  as he saw some infomercial of a similar product,  but a different brand.  I finally gave in just to shut him up.  I started taking one pill in the morning and one in the evening.  That was February 19th. About a month later I noticed I was sleeping much better,  and no longer waking up feeling like I just wanted to hack both my arms off cause I was in so much pain.  I have been taking 4 to 5,  10mg vicodine a day for over a year.  Now I am taking NONE.  Believe it or not,  all my joint pain is 98% gone!! I was so skeptic,  but now I consider this stuff to be worth its weight in gold.  I feel like I now have a new lease on life... Yeah that sounds corny,  but it is the truth!!

title: Amazing Product....and this from a true skeptic
body: First off, let me emphatically state, I WAS NOT PAID TO GIVE THIS REVIEW AND I PAID FULL PRICE FOR THIS SUPPLEMENT. Now having gotten that out of the way, let me say I am amazed. As a skeptic about most things, I was not prepared for this to work so well. My average SYSTOLIC blood pressure was around 160-plus, and my diastolic number was around 90-plus. I just turned 61, and was very concerned about my top number being so high. I have taken this supplement exactly three days. Today my top number was 121 and my bottom number was 82. I have NOT had numbers like this since the 1990's. I have taken a double dose of high BP meds and a statin drug for my cholesterol for 18 months, and the numbers were STILL OUT OF CONTROL. I am no longer a skeptic. Everyone should be taking this supplement. It truly works!!

title: UPDATED: Not the cheapest, but really good value here
body: I can't speak to the physical impact of these on my personal health*, at least not yet, but docs recommend it and that's good enough for me to be taking this supplement since there's otherwise no side effects.  That being said, I've read and heard horror stories about difficulty swallowing and aftertaste of fish oil capsules.  This product has neither of those problems, despite the large size of the individual capsules.  They are shaped and coated in such a way that makes them very easy to swallow.  No fishy-tasting burps.  All-in-all it's been a good experience taking these and the price was comparatively very good.  Not the cheapest on the market, but price compared to quality of reviews made it a strong buy.  I'm glad I went this route.  Don't hesitate to buy it yourself.

title: So far this product has been great! It has helped reduce swelling from tendenitis in ...
body: So far this product has been great!  It has helped reduce swelling from tendenitis in my right middle finger to the point that some days it looks completely normal.  I also had some inflammation in my left knee caused by an injury some years ago.  This fish oil helped that as well.  I hope I continue to see improvement.  I do have an environmental concern, however, about over fishing sardines and other small.  With some companies jumping on the fish oil bandwagon, this could become a more serious issue than it already is.  I would like to see Dr. Tobias' company and others in this group take steps to prevent protect our precious oceans and the vast resources that they contain.

title: Used to be great - Sharp decline in quality recently
body: I've ordered this fish oil brand several times and loved it but the last two bottles were awful. What I loved about this particular brand, besides the nutrient profile, was the fact that I never once got the nasty fish burps that I experienced with most of the previous brands I tried. I plan to call the manufacturer and ask about the cause of the problem, but the last two bottles I received were filled with capsules which were covered in a light coating of oil, making my hands messy and leaving a really bad taste in my mouth each time I consumed them. And then regardless of whether I ate and/or drank before or after, these latest capsules give me the fish burps every time. It's too bad because I'm going to have to switch my Amazon subscription to the brand I used before, Nordic Naturals, which are great but a bit more expensive.

title: It works great for people with Reynaud's disease!
body: I have suffered from Reynaud's disease for a long time and for the past two years was taking a blood pressure lowering med (nifedipine) to help in the winter months. After I ran out of nifedipine I started reading about natural ways of stopping Reynaud's attacks. I had tried Ginkgo Biloba before, but didn't like the way it made the blood rush to my hands/feet/face...it felt like I was burning. I decided to try omega 3 fish pills after reading studies that in some people, this supplement helped with Reynauds. I have been taking these pills for several weeks now and they work very well, as well as the nifedipine, and although my hands get cold, I have noticed a dramatic decrease in the number of Reynaud's attacks. I will definitely continue taking these during the winter months.

I was offered a second free bottle but didn't have to write a review to get it. I personally cannot trust any review that is in response to something free. title: I am amazed and pleased that you can get such a large ...
body: I will never buy ANY OTHER fish oil again!!  When most products claim they are "burp-less", it's just wishful thinking, and you DO experience a fishy taste when you burp after you take those other fish oils. NOT with this product. I am amazed and pleased that you can get such a large dose of EPA & DHA in a pill without that nasty fishy burping afterwards. And despite the pill size, it is VERY easy to swallow, because there are no seams like some other capsules. It just slides right down. I used to take Krill Oil instead of fish oil, but then I realized that I was not getting the recommended/beneficial amount of EPA & DHA from those; so now I just take a separate Astaxanthin pill and Dr. Tobias' triple strength fish oil, and I've really noticed a difference in my joints (less knee pain when bending or squatting). I would never buy any other brand, because this one is so outstanding, effective & tasteless (in a good way).

title: Taking Optimum Omega Fish Oil for Depression
body: I have been taking Dr. Tobia's Optimum Omega 3 Fish Oil Pills for 2 weeks now. They do not have any flavor whatsoever when I take them. I take 3 per day to get the amount of EPA/DHA required to prevent depression as recommended by the book, "The Depression Cure". I have noticed that my hair is shinier already and my skin is staying very clear (I suffer from acne). I do have a little more energy than I had before, but am not sure whether it is due to taking these fish oil pills. I just finished weaning myself off of my Zoloft antidepressant two weeks ago when I began taking the fish oil. I am also using light therapy equivalent to 10,000 LUX most days, so the increase in energy could also be the result of this or the combination of light therapy and fish oil. It is too soon to say all the benefits of the fish oil, however, this brand was one of the most affordable I could find online of its quality. I have noticed a few fish burps when I take it in the morning, so I started taking the fish oil at night and that solved this. I will have to update my post after taking it for a few months. I have to allow my brain chemistry to return back to normal without taking antidepressants to see if this fish oil really helps as scientists and physicians claim. I will let you know.
