title: It works!
body: This is a follow on to my review of a few months back (see below).  Since I started taking 2 pills per day, I have had my cholesterol tested twice (I am under medication and do it every 6 months).  I have seen further improvement in LDL and HDL levels, but, more important, my triglycerides level went down from 180 to 120.  During this time, i have lost some weight (4 lbs) but I have not exercised noticeably more.  My conclusion is that it is the fish oil that has been the primary factor to bring down my triglycerides level.

title: Definitely one of the best fish oils for the money
body: There are a lot of fish oil products that use dishonest marketing, and for anyone interested in adding fish oil to your regime the most important thing is the DHA/EPA content as well as ratio. This product has a favorable DHA/EPA ratio as well as 1,400mg of both combined per capsule. The capsules are coated well so that the fishy aftertaste is covered, and taking two a day (which gives you a high amount of these omega 3's) will last you 3 months. I can't find anything wrong with the product after weeks of use so hence the 5 stars.

title: So far so good...
body: I recently had a physical with my doctor and was told that I needed to seriously consider using an Omega 3 supplement.  He tried to get me to sign up for a sponsored supplement that a doctor recommendation was required.  I asked for a brochure of the product so that I could research on my own if I could get the same ingredients in and open market environment.  That is where I found Dr. Tobias formula on Amazon.  It is one of the few Omega 3 formulas that has the recommended EPA/DHA dosage that met the doctor=sponsored requirements at a much better price point.  I have been taking this supplement consistently for about 3 weeks now and all is well.  No fishy odor or aftertaste present at all.  I will await my next blood test to evaluate the benefit of the supplement, but I have noticed some better skin conditioning that I actually was not expecting.

title: Fewer calories, more omega 3 fatty acids, no burbs - what's not to like?
body: I've been taking NatureMade burpless fish oil (2 pills in the morning, 2 at night) for some time and gotten good results in my cholesterol (bad down, good up), though I should state I also take Niaspan.  At any rate, the Dr. Tobias brand offered more omega 3 fatty acid per pill, lower calories, and claimed to be burp less.  Moreover, some studies I read about (especially one from Harvard) suggested I could get more benefit if I took in a bit more omega 3 fatty acid.  So I tried it out (2 pills in the morning, 2 at night).  From an experience perspective, it's been fine.  No burbs or after taste.  I'll see when I go for my annual physical if the cholesterol numbers are even better.  But I'm quite happy about getting more  fatty acid for fewer calories and the same experience.

Finally I decided to read the Amazon reviews and purchase a product that has great reviews and see if I felt any difference. So I purchased the Dr. Tobias Optimum Omega 3 Fish Oil. I guess the old saying is so true...you get what you pay for.

title: A top-notch product, but bothered my gut and reflux
body: I like the dosing, which keeps me from having to take so many softgels a day, but these bothered my gut and my acid reflux.  The issue is, I'm sure, with my system, not the product, but I wanted to mention it in case others with irritable bowel, candida, GERD, etc., are considering this product.  Certainly, your mileage may vary.  This seems like a pure, well made product that I'm sure works well for a lot of people.  The Optimum Nutrition fish oil tends to work better for me, but the dosing isn't as convenient as the Dr. Tobias product.

title: Made my sweat smell like dog urine.
body: I'm not sure how beneficial it was for me, but I think it made my sweat smell like dog urine. For weeks I could smell urine... somewhere... I started cleaning like I had OCD, I washed every couch cushion, I used an entire 64oz of Nature's Way in the living room, I rented a carpet shampooer about once a week, I sprayed febreeze on everything like it was napalm and my stuff Vietnam. Still I could smell dog urine. I almost replaced all my furniture and redid the floors the smell was so unbearable. But then I noticed the my burps occasionally smelled a little like dog urine too. I decided to see what would happen if I stopped taking the fish oil. That was yesterday, today the smell is pretty much gone, no febreeze or carpet shampooing necessary. If I had spent thousands of dollars replacing all my stuff because of a supplement I would have been... pissed.

title: not fishy
body: I bought this since I recently started getting really dry eyes when I wear contacts -- which I'd never had before.  I read online that fish oil can somehow help with dry eyes.  I've worn contacts once or twice since starting to take these daily and noticed a slight improvement. By the end of a workday of sitting at my desk staring at a computer, my contacts used to be unbearable. They still feel noticeably dry, but at least I don't feel like ripping them out, it's just more of a dull irritation. Hopefully it continues to improve.  Another bonus is that, while it may taste fishy going down, the fish smell/taste doesn't come back to haunt you later.

It may have just been an odd experience, but not something to toss out the window.

He is happy with the tablets so far..  When he takes his blood test in three months we will know if they are working. title: ... week now and on the positive side I feel like it is helping my joints somewhat as I suffer ...
body: I have been taking this for a week now and on the positive side I feel like it is helping my joints somewhat as I suffer from rheumatoid arthritis.  There is absolutely no fishy taste or burping. On the negative side I am experiencing bloating and much gas from it so I have reduced my intake to one a day and am experimenting with different times of day. Hoping this goes away with time.  Otherwise happy with it!

title: Good Product But Capsules May Be Broken
body: My first bottle was just fine. No fishy taste or anything like that. My second bottle had a broken capsule near the top. Nearby capsules feel oily and some even taste fishy because they're coated in fish oil. I have no clue what the chances of that happening are and don't feel the need to return my four other bottles of this product (I'm stocked up until the end of summer on a lot of supplements). I really like the EPA and DHA percentages. For me to meet my goals, I must take six capsules of these a day, but taking pills is easy for me. Quality fish oil can be rather expensive; I find this product is currently priced reasonably (04/05/2014).

title: I was hoping for better results. I took my first capsule about 2 ...
body: Well, I was hoping for better results.  I took my first capsule about 2 hours ago after breakfast with cool tea.  It doesn't taste fishy at all but after about 30 min it started to come back on me.  I took a tums to see if this would help settle my stomach, but it didn't really help.  I'm been burping fishy for a while now, it is less than other brands but not eliminated by any means.

title: They go down easy with a sip of water.
body: So far so good. I feel like they are helping because I currently don't consume much oil, besides what I put on my skin. I have dry eye issues. Perhaps consuming more oil will lubricate my body. It does have a mild fishy smell but nothing too bothersome. I like that they don't get stuck in my throat. It's a nice touch and it makes me feel like I'm getting something back for paying so much. Alittle on the pricey side. This is the first time I've spent this much on a vitamin/supplement.

title: very fishy taste
body: Omega-3 fatty acids have wonderful health benefits, and I anticipate that this product is no different. however, of all the omega-3 supplements I've tried, this one has the fishiest taste of all. It's a problem because if you try to put your pills and supplements in a weekly/monthly pill box, the fishy scent will permeate all your other pills. In addition, this is the only omega-3 supplement that has given me the fishy aftertaste and fishy burps, which are quite unpleasant. Because of the taste, I plan to try a different brand in the future.

title: Overall pretty good product for the price and pretty good amounts ...
body: What I can say is that I was experiencing some cognitive problems about 1 month ago.  Along with some changes, diet, exercise, vitamins and other activities, I also started taking these fish oil capsules.  Overall, what I can say about these pills is that they really have improved my mood and honestly stabilized my emotions significantly.  I know it was not the the other positive activities mentioned above because in the past they were not as effective.  I've also noticed some noticeable improvements in cognition as well.  Overall pretty good product for the price and pretty good amounts of DHA and EPA compared to some of the other brands.  Definitely will keep taking these. They also provided me a free bottle just from buying the first which was nice as well.

title: Very Effective Without Fishy Aftertaste
body: On advice of my ND, I take a 8000 mg (8 capsules) of Omega 3 Fish Oil daily, so it's important to me that it be free of heavy metals and that it doesn't have an aftertaste.  Dr. Tobias brand meets both of these needs. This supplement has not only lowered my cholesterol by 20 points, it has eliminated stiffness in my hands and knees. I've tried other brands, but am sticking with Dr Tobias.

title: Fish Burps

I have tried other fish oil product (Nordic Naturals for example) and did not have fish burps.  Based on the high reviews for this product, I assume that my personal experience is not indicative of the average buyer.

title: They get the job done
body: I chose to order these pills because I particularly wanted omega 3 oils, not just fish oils in general.  If a company won't state the amount of their oils that are omega 3, you can probably assume they're quite low.  I need take only two pills a day to get a reasonable dosage of the omega 3s, where other pills on the market would require more.  The pills themselves are encased in casings that are a little powdery.  They are large enough that they're hard to swallow, but I just hold them in my mouth until I can squeeze the oil out.  I figure this will help my blood numbers, and my doctor can feel more content.

title: Eneteric coatings work only when your gut is empty.
body: Enertic coatings go just so far. The pill must be taken well before eating, 1st thing in the morn, or the pill will "melt" in your gut, and voila, fish oil taste and burps. I suggest not eating with foods because that will prevent the pill from getting into the intestine, the enteric intention. I therefore don't feel therz a benefit over a hi-grade uncoated fish oil pill taken the same way--1st thing in the morn, alone, and perhaps with a digestive enzyme.

title: No aftertaste or fishy burp
body: These seem to work well: four stars because my dog (these are for her and for us) doesn't seem to like the outside coating, but my guess is that it's for the same reason that humans WOULD like it (it doesn't smell or taste like fish oil).

title: FALSE CLAIMS!
body: FALSE CLAIMS! These claimed to be burpless capsules and that it had no fishy aftertaste which is why I bought these. I was looking to switch from what I was already using, Essential Omega 3 because that was so expensive. It was a bad move on my part and now I am out of pocket $30. These pills are nasty and vile to say the least. I ended up burping the whole entire day and the aftertaste was disgusting to the point where I was sick to stomach. I am very disappointed in this purchase and definitely will not be making this purchase again. Regardless of cost I will stick with my Essential Omega 3.

title: This fish oil was great in my opinion
body: This fish oil was great in my opinion. Just like the description states there is no fishy after taste and does not give me heartburn or indigestion. I use fish oil supplements on a daily basis for many years to control my cholesterol and keep joint inflammation at a minimum. This product is one that I will be continue using in the future, Thank You Dr. Tobias for creating a great fish oil supplement!!

title: I don't know if I just received a terrible bottle or if this is the norm but I ...
body: I returned my bottle immediately.  I opened up the bottle to the most rancid fishy smell.  I've never had a bottle of fish oil smell so much.  I don't know if I just received a terrible bottle or if this is the norm but I did not request a replacement.

title: Not worth it!
body: Don't believe the hype over these pills. The pills are obnoxiously large and have a faint odor of fish. That should be the first indication that they will have a bad aftertaste. Indeed they do. They gave me bad indigestion with foul fishy burps. It was suggested by my doctor to stop taking these as there may be impure ingredients not mentioned. I switched to Omega XL which I purchase direct as Amazon does not have them. It's been 3 weeks and I have never had an issue with Omega XL. They apparently are 100% pure with absolutely no bad fillers, and never a fishy burp.

title: Product and Company are excellent!!
body: I am a solid satisfied customer of Dr. Tobias Omega 3 Fish Oil pills.  The product is without parallel as is their customer service.  In my experience they are the best and deserve the acclaim they receive from other faithful customers.  Somewhat rare to have a company stand on all they promise. Great company!

title: I ordered this after my chiropractor recommended adding fish oil to my diet to reduce inflammation
body: I ordered this after my chiropractor recommended adding fish oil to my diet to reduce inflammation.  I used to take another brand and I hated it!  I used to burp up the flavor and it was gross.  This product does not have that side effect. It goes down easy and you don't ever taste it again.  I feel better, but I have made a number of adjustments to my lifestyle so I am not sure how much I contribute to taking the Omega 3, but hey it certainly doesn't hurt!

title: First time was good and it made me want to purchase their product ...
body: Ordered 2 times of this item. First time was good and it made me want to purchase their product again. The 2nd time it arrived with a very pale color compared to the first time and when I tried to take the pill I ended up spitting it out as it was extremely bitter which made me suspicious. The content of the capsule were extremely liquid and I ended up throwing the entire thing away. There was no noticeable damage on the seal but I'm not sure if I inspected it good enough. One thing I'm sure of is that I have 30$ in my trashcan right now.

body: I bought these because based on the reviews, I was under the impression that these wouldn't have a gross fishy aftertaste (aka fishy burps). They do. Not only that, but you have to take 2 pills a day, and they're fairly large pills. To make things worse, ever since I've ordered these, I've gotten at least 3 or 4 emails from the company that makes it telling me to leave them a review and just generally spamming my account. Well, here's that review you wanted.

title: I've never consistently stuck with them because they caused me to have bad fish burps
body: I received my Omega 3 about a week ago. I purchased these because I was recently diagnosed with some skin issues, also my bloodwork indicated I needed more healthy fat in my diet. I've taken other omega 3 supplements that were less expensive. I've never consistently stuck with them because they caused me to have bad fish burps. Dr. Tobias Omega supplements are bur free. Also, I hope they help clear up some skin issues over time.

title: Like many others have said
body: This product arrived in a timely manner. Like many others have said, these pills don't stick together like other brands do and there's no fishy after taste. For big pills, they are very easy to swallow. As for my blood pressure, I just graduated college and started a new job, before taking fish oil, my blood pressure was pretty high, but now it's in the 110-120, systolic, which is great. I will definitely be buying more!

title: So stinky!
body: This would probably be better if some of the pills hadn't broken open, the bottle stinks so bad I gag every time I try to take them. I didn't open the bottle until it was too late to return, so I can't return it, my fault I didn't check it right when it came. Just check your bottle right when it comes and then you will be able to return it if there's a problem, I feel like I wasted my money on this one. SO stinky!

I like this product and will be ordering more. It worked for me, but each and everyone of us is different so not everything will work for everyone. But I like this project.

body: So far so good.  I have always had troubles with very dry hands when the cold weather sets in and since using these pills, my hands are looking very good. I took the time to compare the labels for all the major brands (easy to do on Amazon) and it was really a non brainer. I really don't think about it - just re-order, throw them into my daily pill organizer and go about being healthy - that' about it - one major self care step in a bottle. Thanks Doc.

title: I hate fish and these are great.

title: High Quality, Great Value
body: Let's face it...everyone's talking about fish oil and you can buy it almost anywhere.  I bought this brand in particular because the price was fantastic for a fish oil pill that actually contains the DHA/EPA that is recommended in a day.  The pill smells good, it leaves no aftertaste, and is easy to swallow.  I highly recommend this product and the company's customer service is outstanding as well.

title: Great customer service and great product
body: I will definitely be buying from them again. I ordered the pills from them and unfortunately when I got them they smelled fishy, but when I contacted them about that they sent me two replacement bottles for the one bottle I had ordered. The replacements were just as described not fishy odor or taste. They have great customer service and a great product.

title: A pleasant surprise
body: First I would like to say that I have GERD, stomach ulcers, IBS, conditions which were aggravated by some of the several brands I tried but could not "stomach".

title: It really does work!
body: 2.5 weeks in, and no more knee pain! Word to the wise- start with 1 capsule/day (if you aren't used to taking fish oil) for a few days, and then start the regular dose (2 capsules) by day 4 or 5. I started with 2 right off the bat, without having taken fish oil before, and I got really upset stomach and nausea. However, at this point (2-3 weeks into taking), I have no stomach upset, and my sore knees that have been bothering me for years are no more.

title: QUALITY PRODUCT
body: Wanted to leave a review because I'm very impressed with customer service! I received the product quickly; it was packaged nicely and I've received several emails with offers and thanking me. And the actual vitamin - looks impressive. I'll Will have to leave another review after taking the vitamin for a few months.

I'm taking it along with doing exercise and light box therapy on a daily basis. I feel better than I have in a long time. It has the right amount of EPA and DHA for what I'm looking for. Thanks Dr. Tobias this has been a step in my recovery!

title: I switched to another brand and almost instantly my dry eye was better and the burps are gone
body: I've taken one daily for over 9 months for dry eye problems after getting ill from another brand that arrived rancid.  I was not able to get relief from dry eye and the fish burps lasted most of the day.  I switched to another brand and almost instantly my dry eye was better and the burps are gone.

title: No results yet
body: I started taking this supplement about 1 month ago, hoping to improve the pain of arthritis on my left knee and ankle. I'm a former long distance runner and definitely overdid it. I'm also a Personal Trainer so I have to be able to train, even though I don't run anymore. So far I can't say that I see any difference. The level of pain is the same, but I don't think I have taken it long enough. I will write another feedback in a couple of months,

title: Not Bad.
body: It contains soy which isn't good for men and their testosterone levels, although, soy does help lower cholesterol levels. I do smell a little bit of fish but personally, it's not a big deal. I take almost anything regularly which helps with my "heart health". So far, I'm pleased with Dr. Tobias' product.

title: it works!
body: I must say that this product works very well, I can tell the difference in my skin and have even noticed a difference in clarity of mindset as well.

title: Worst fishy aftertaste of any brand.
body: I've been taking fish oil for years. I've taken many different brands and strengths, but none have ever compared in the terrible aftertaste that lingers for hours after taking these. Unless you REALLY enjoy the taste of metallic salmon, I would recommend cheap grocery store brand fish oil over these pills.

title: Gastric Bypass Patients MUST take Omega Oils!
body: I've taken many, many supplements for years to "test" them on myself before recommending them to those I counsel. The Dr.Tobias Omegas are easy to swallow, easy to digest (I'm a successful RNY Gastric Bypass patient from the 90s) and keep my blood sugar balanced so I don't struggle with post-meal drunk and sleep if I eat carbs. I DO keep these refrigerated, but either way, no fish repeats or PU-stench when I open the bottle. Love them!

title: I have  done alot of research to explore adequate DHA and EPA and few to noe compare to Dr. Tobias.
body: I have tried many Fish Oil Products and Dr. Tobias outranks them all. I did a lot of research to explore adequate DHA and EPA and few to none even compare. There is no fishy taste and the price is excellent. I do appreciate that Dr. Tobias' product tells you on the front of the label, how much of each supplement (DHA, EPA) are in each dosage, unlike all the rest.  I only ask what is the remaining 600 mg of fish oil-ALA?  Regardless, both my husband and I, love it! Thank you!

title: Fish Burps to the Max!
body: I have tried at least eight different brands of fish oil pills. Ranging from very expensive to the cheap ones at Costco (Nature's Valley). None of those pills has ever given me fish burps, but the Dr. Tobias pills give me horrible burps. I first tried taking two after dinner as recommended, and it made my stomach hurt and I had really bad burps. I tried taking one in the morning after breakfast, and I had burps through lunch. I would not recommend these pills.

body: I used  to suffer horrible and constant sinus infections from Candida.  I changed my diet, consume an ounce of colloidal silver each day, take coconut oil, oregano oil, grapefruit seed extract, Omega-3, vitamin c and use Silver Sinus Nasal Spray (although I consider it an ionic, which is better for topical use).  5 stars.

body: I have been a user of omega 3's for many years as eating cold water fish is not my idea of a good time!  This is one of the best I have used and no bad after taste.  Has all the right ingredients in a simple tablet that is shaped to swallow!  Highly recommend.

body: Two stars because it contains soy. Soy is not a womens friend ...but if that's not an issue for you, these are just fine. No fishy after taste or burps. They are large pills though.

body: Rating two stars as the fish oil that was purchased was rancid, and damaged due to delivery, and ineligible to return as well. Other than that I have received this product when it is not damaged and it does have all the health benefits of fish oil with all the quality. Rancid fish oil is bad for your health and I was experiencing chest pain and burping due to the bad batch.

title: No changes
body: While I believe this is a quality product (I cut one open and it hardly smelled fishy at all), it did nothing to improve my mood, energy, sleep, digestion, thinking, etc. that other people claim it helped.  So it is not worth the expense for me.

body: Stronger fish odor then previous bottles.  As I got down lower in the bottle I found the reason, there were several broken capsules.  By the time I found them it was too late to return.  Guess I'm out the money. Won't buy them again.

title: Very pleased with this mindfully crafted product
body: Very pleased with this mindfully crafted product. Very digestible, no taste. Product was cleanly and freshly packed and Tobias sent a follow e mail with info about their free videos. Prompt shipping came right to door! Very happy!  I am a discriminating and comparison shopper but have now changed from my fish oil brand of 10 years to this one.  Thank you Dr. Tobias for a great product.

body: Not bad. These pills are big though.  I just switched to Nordic Naturals Algae Omega 120 ct.  The Omega 3's that the fish get come from algae, so I figured I'd just as well go to the source.

body: Great Product so far! Looking forward to my next blood results shortly!

title: This Product is the real deal
body: This product is working for me. I noticed a difference in my knees just after taking for two weeks twice a day. It was a rainy day on those days I usually suffer. I noticed I was not in pain and then it hit me. Wow this stuff is for real. My knees are thanking me. Try it for yourself.

title: What's not to like
body: My doctor says I need to take Omega 3 capsules. These have a high rating, the price is right and I love the coating that makes them easier to swallow and  lets them dissolve in my gut instead of my stomach. If you've ever suffered from constipation you should give these a try...they've been helpful for me.

title: Good stuff! Especially recommend for traveling.
body: I've been taking fish pills for more than a decade. I just assumed fish burps and sticky, clumpy gel caps were part of what fish pills were all about. Recently, a friend of mine recommended Dr Tobias fish pills so I bought a jar.

title: Great Omega 3
body: I love these pills. I was worried that i would that nasty after burp up fish small or taste and im sure u know what I mean. Lol. I feel with a lot more energetic thought the day.  I stongly recomend them even if they are a little more money then the other brands but you get ur moneys worth.

title: love it!
body: I've tried many omega 3 supplements and this one is by far my favorite, I highly recommend it. There is no fishy after taste and no fishy taste as you take it, my hair and skin look so much healthier after just taking it for a month.

title: Great for pain relief!
body: I'm so glad I found these fish oil vitamins! I was suffering from hip pain on and off for several months before taking these. I read that Omega 3s can help reduce inflammation and I saw that this particular brand had great reviews. Within a few days of taking these (two after dinner every night) the pain was gone. After two months of taking these, I came down with a stomach virus and didn't take any supplements for three days. By the fourth day, the virus was gone but the hip pain was back! I took these that night and by the next morning the pain was gone. I'm quite sure these Omega 3s are responsible for the pain relief (I'm also taking a regular multivitamin - but I don't expect pain relief from a multivitamin). I should add that I've taken other Omega 3s in the past and didn't notice any effect, good or bad, so I think the potency and quality of this particular brand is the key. I haven't had any problems with fishy aftertaste or stomach upset. I'll definitely be re-ordering these!

title: Poor baby fishes.
body: So many pills and they're fairly large, though easily swallowed. I feel terrible for the poor fishes though, I heard fish pills are made by pressing little fishes in presses, like a vice, and extracting their juices. Poor little creatures... They're not cute though so I guess it balances out.

body: No fishy taste. No sticky pills. Good addition to our regular supplements. Will re-purchase when I am out of these pills.  I find pretty much everything I need on Amazon and I like using these ratings to choose products.

They have a somewhat harder covering and I find I am able to swallow two at a time without gagging. I'll definitely continue to buy these.

body: I have been taking Carlson Fish Oil for many years. I read the fish oil reviews on Labdoor, and I was impressed with their No 1. Quality choice, Dr. Tobias. I was, in particular, impressed with the extremely high DHA content. I decided to switch, and I have been very satisfied since doing so.

body: This is the best fish oil made by real fish.  Most fish oils are made by people.  They should be called people oil.  That's not American.  If you're American and want take fish oil as a supplement, take this fish oil made by fish.  Don't let the terrorist win.

body: I have not experienced the fish burps or the nausea that others have indicated in their reviews. I like the simple dosing. The ultimate deciding factor will be my lab results which won't be due yet for another two months.

title: Contains soy. Deal breaker.
body: Contains soy. So it's a deal breaker for me. Also the gelatin is made from bovine (cow) and I only eat meat RARELY and only from grass fed organic sources. This could be adding to your toxic load of xeno estrogens just FYI, and we get enough of those everywhere. Don't need a supplement to add to the load. I should have checked the label with more scrutiny before I bought and took a bunch of them. "Natural Vitamin E" is almost nearly soy based in supps. Just beware. Everything I read about fish oil products in my research these days is that it has a high incidence of rancidity. I'll just eat the fish when I can. And leave these supplements out of my diet when I feel they'll do more harm than good. Always remember that these are NOT approved by the FDA nor are they regulated in any way. Buyer beware.

I am taking it because I was trying to match the ingredients in a prescription medication of fish oil that is very expensive. This came the closest. Now, I will wait until I have my blood work done again and I will be able to compare what happens with my cholesterol and triglycerides.

title: No fishy aftertaste
body: My doctor suggested I use a fish oil supplement to lower my triglycerides. A friend who is a nurse recommended Dr. Tobias Omega 3. I couldn't be happier. There's no fishy aftertaste that I have experienced with other products. I started exercising a bit more at the same time that I started Dr. Tobias's fish oil. I have lost some weight in the last month, and feel more energetic.

title: Two Thumbs Down
body: Would not buy again. My wife, who has used other fish oil capsules, complained that these lodged in her throat. Also the capsules cannot be frozen or refrigerated (to avoid fish burps) because they are brittle and shatter when you puncture them. This is important to me because we give fish oil to our dog who obviously is not designed to swallow capsules whole. We have never had this problem with other fish oil capsules.

title: Worth it.
body: Dr. Tobias fish oil pills are worth the investment.  My eye doctor suggested I take them for dry eye (although they are beneficial for so many other things).  After only a month, I already notice improvment.  The only side effect are "fishy burps" which aren't too bad and only last an hour or two after you take the pills.  Worth the investment!

title: Bitter and disgusting
body: Dr Tobias Omega 3 Fish Oil Pills (180) Triple Strength tastes awful. The gel capsules are very bitter and disgusting. Plus, you have to take 2 of them in a serving. I've tried a few brands of fish oil supplements and this is, by far, the worst. I purchased two bottles one for myself and one for my mother to try. I wish I had only bought one, but the positive ratings on Amazon swayed me. I will not buy this brand again and would not recommend it to others.

title: Haven't needed to open this current supply yet.
body: I received my order of Omega 3 Fish Oil Pills - Triple Strength Fish Oil Supplements promptly and in good order. However, because I have not yet finished taking my present supply from another source, I have not taken any from this order. I purchased it based upon its excellent reviews and believe that I will be pleased with them once I begin taking them. That's the reason for my three-star "It's ok" rating.

title: Fishy smell that wasn't there in earlier bottles
body: I should have heeded a recent reviewer who said something had changed with this fish oil. He was right! The capsules have an unpleasant fishy smell, which I noticed the minute I opened the bottle. I have ordered this product before and still have some capsules left in that bottle, so I was able to do a direct comparison. The prior capsules have a pleasant non-fishy slightly vanilla-ish smell. I have found them very pleasant to take. I'm disappointed in the new formulation and frankly horrified at the apparent lack of quality control. Will not buy again.

title: Amazing results
body: I'm a 50 year old man and have been taking Teakwondo (TKD) for about 9 months. I noticed that my knees would ache some after class and I started doing some research to find something natural that would help. That's when I found Omega 3 and decided to give it a try.

title: Inner Seal Not Intact Heavy Fish Smell
body: I purchased this in April but took a few months to begin using.  When I broke the outside seal and opened the bottle I found that the inner seal had come off the top. Noticed a very obvious fishy smell and the fish oil caps were very sticky.  Not what I would expect from reading all the reviews.  I would send it back but as I had mentioned I purchased them a few months before opening.  I am not sure I want to ingest them at this point.

title: It Does not Meet the Claim of Burpless!!
body: I'm not sure how effective this product is. I know this, it give me the burps. Not the kind of thing you want because when you burp, it tastes and smells like fish. Now, I know I did not eat fish for breakfast, so I was a bit confused the first time it happened. It happens within 10-25min of ingesting the pills. It's nasty feeling in your mouth, not a fish lover and hence why I take these supplements.

title: One Star

title: Customer centered company
body: This company has been diligent about making sure I am satisfied with their product.  I am using fish oil to maximize the effects of my exercise regime and am feeling great.

title: Helps me with my postpartum depression
body: This helps me out so much with my postpartum depression. I should not rely on this alone I know but I generally do not have many problems with depression anymore since I started taking fish oil pills! The real test came in after I had my second daughter 4 months ago. Throughout the body changes I was always happy and not moody even with the lack of sleep.....then I ran out. It took a while but I noticed for me that I started feeling off. I just received my second bottle so I am hoping to be back to my normal self. I also found that when I used it while working out before pregnancy I had more lean muscle and my physique just seemed to be pretty good!  I take one pill and I'm the odd person out who cannot swallow pills so I do chew it and spit out the casing. I do not have fishy burps, feel sick or anything different outside of the benefits I mentioned. I'm not a Dr. and I'm not telling you to take these and all of your problems especially mental ones will go away, so use your personal judgement because I do not know how it will react with your body.  This is just my experience!

title: Chic Euro Haircut
body: The product seems pretty good.  Honestly I don't know enough to distinguish 1 fish oil pill from another.  However Dr. Tobias obnoxiously spams my email with offers, constantly "thanking" me for being a costumer.  Enough already, I'll take your free bottle of fish oil and be gone. No more videos with your chic Euro haircut and pierced ear Dr. Tobias.  Stop taking credit for all the hardworking peons who have slaved over a rotting fish carcass to make your product.  Also, if your pills don't make me half as bad-ass as this bear shown on your website, I'll be suing for false advertising.

title: Unbelievable they really do work! Feeling good just about every day now.
body: I have been taking these omega-3 for approximately 5 months now.  I searched and searched for a natural way to subdued my lower chronic back pain that I have had for many years and almost had figured that I would just have to live with it for the rest of my life. Until I saw an info commercial one night about the green lipid muscle from New Zealand Sea, which Explained how this particular oil could help decrease pain. Which were expensive.  That was the beginning of my search.  Then I found Dr. Tobias  omega-3 fish oil EPA DHA (affordably priced) while searching for the perfect combination of a fish oil pills.  Afterk reading the other reviews I decided to try it.  I can't even begin to tell you how incredible I feel.  My lower back pain is gone 90% of the time now.  These really do work and I believe it is because of the combination of the EPA and the DHA in them. I have also purchased approximately five bottles for family and friends who have had issues with chronic pain in their lower back, neck, arthritis and hip pain.  I have heard back from two who had neck pain and the other lower back pain and they said, that there pain has definitely decreased and feel much better.  I would definitely encourage anyone to try these.  After all it is a small price to pay to help relieve any pain issues someone might have.  Not to mention considering all the other benefits that come along with taking this omega 3 fish oil EPA/DHA pill.

title: This product is not actually "fish oil" but DHA/EPA fatty acid ethyl esters which caused me extreme joint pain
body: This product caused extrme joint pain within two days.  That is a known side effect of "Ethyl Esters" which are a product of the process of chemically concentrating the EPA/DHA in actual fish oil by processing it with ethanol. Technically this process results in semisynthetic oils as the fish oil has been broken apart and recombined.  Ethyl Ester compounds (of which this product is entirely composed)  are not a natural component of fish oil.  The alternative are fish oils which contain their DHA/EPA as triglycerides which are naturally ocurring and more stable (less subject to oxidation) but will not be "concentrated."

title: Helps Immensley with Knee Pain
body: I started using these after my 11 year old dog, Riggs came down with cancer. He had already been suffering with arthritis of the hips and was on 50 mg of an NSAID everyday. After surgery, our Vet suggested an Omega3 supplement to aid with inflammation. After 3 weeks, we noticed a huge improvement in his quality of life, to the point that we cut his medication back to every 4 days!

title: Three Stars

title: Amazing Fish Oil
body: I started taking this Fish Oil on 8/3/2015.  I hold off writing this review because I want to make sure that I give it time to see what it does to my health.  Last October I have had tennis elbow and went through 6 weeks of physical therapy.  The therapy helped somewhat but the pain never went away.  I then started taking Nature Made Fish oil and Kirkland Fish oil.  However, I don't see any result and my pain still linger.  A few days ago, I just noticed I could move my elbow freely because the pain is gone.  The only different is that I have been taking this fish oil since 5 weeks ago.  I am extremely pleased with this fish oil and hope that other customers will give it a try.  Please be patient, unlike drug it might take times to build up in one's system.  I will definitely recommend this fish oil to anyone who want to have healthy well being in general.  I am glad I found this oil.

title: Helped A Lot
body: Really helped with the pain i was having in my joints, and getting me to think with more focus again. Great product

title: Excellent, Effective Product
body: Excellent product, and a great family-owned business with great customer support. Cut my triglycerides to 1/3 (along with other diet and exercise changes) after only a few months of use -- and no "fish burps."

title: Finally finished a whole bottle and I couldn't tell a ...
body: Finally finished a whole bottle and I couldn't tell a difference from other fish oils I have tried. I felt overwhelmed by the frequent promotional emails from the company. They kept emailing me about rating their company and the opportunity to get free products. I won't buy again and I'm not sure that I trust the company anymore.

title: High quality fish oil!
body: I'm a family physician and an avid runner.  I take fish oil because it is a great alternative way to reduce joint pain.  It's also important in our brains and helps keep blood triglyceride levels low.  Many fish oil products use rancid oils and this is evidenced by the dreaded "fishy burp."  This is a high quality product and very effective for my purposes since it helps with my knee pain and keeps me from having to be a regular NSAID user.

title: Awful
body: Awful. I don't why this gets such rave reviews, possibly because the reviewers are promised a free product? Amazon should STOP that practice, it poisons the well of honest reviews. To say this is not fishy tasty is crazy. I was getting sick to my stomach from the gross smell/taste of the product. Maybe I got a bad batch, but all the more reason to give it one star. Regrettably, I ended up throwing away the balance of the bottle after taking it for about a week. I'm going back to 100% fish oil in a bottle that you take by a spoon (not from this manufacturer tho). It's less convenient but it's most certainly less processed and handled. This is an honest review, I am not affiliated with anyone.

So great and well, healthy for me. Very happy. Can't say enough about my wonder pill from GNC.

title: great pain reliever
body: My son is strong into crossfit, and has had injuries.  He never takes motrin, just uses this product.  I am 57 years old and don't really have any knee cartilage and am wildly out of shape and overweight. I started crossfit one month ago, and of cours was very sore the next day.  I started living on motrin 600mg every 4 to 6 hours and started experiencing gastric upset, and was still having pain.  My son gently recommended this supplement, and I finally tried it.  I am a nurse practitioner, and am always worried about supplements, but I read up on this one and gave it a try.  What a difference.  I only took one pill before bed, and was able to sleep without waking up in pain. I started taking it during the day and no longer take motrin ( making my liver happier). I have not had the fish burps at all.  I was using a liquid lemon flavored fish oil occasionally and never experienced pain relief, and the taste was awful.  If you are looking for a good fish oil that seems to do a great job, give it a try!

title: Eau de Fish Processing Plant
body: I'm sure these are great for my health.  They are easy to swallow and give no fishy aftertaste or burps.  No problems with stomach upset or bathroom issues.  All that said...the smell is AWFUL.  I tried putting them in my pill keeper.  Nope.  Made all my medications and the pill keep reek.  Then, I tried putting the bottle (tightly closed) in the medicine cabinet.  Nope.  Every time I opened the door, Eau de Dead Fish wafted out.  When I open the bottle to get my pill, I have to turn the ceiling fan on in the bath.  It smells so bad.  I also have to wash my hands after touching the capsules.  I am going to try other brands/products.  This is just so smelly!

title: Easier to take than those big fish oil pills but...
body: MegaRed probably worked out okay as far as consuming Omega 3 fatty acid and it may be the right thing for people who can't or won't eat safe fish with the needed quantities of Omega 3 on a regular basis.  About 8-9 years ago, a pain doctor told me to take a lot of certain brand of fish oil pills a day.  I did it for a while but I couldn't see it helping my pain and after a couple months, I quit taking them.  A couple years ago, I got some tests results back that showed I was very deficient in Omega 3 fatty acid and a few other nutrients.  Also, I had high cholesterol and other problems that could lead to some serious health problems, if I continued down the same path.  MegaRed Krill Oil is certainly easier to take than those big fish oil pills that I was supposed to be taking.  But, to me, this was just another fishy pill to buy and to deal with each day.  Sardines turned out to be the best option for me.  The whole sardines are the best quality but I really don't like looking at those little dead minnows in the can but boneless and skinless helps that problem a little by making them look less like little dead minnows.  It took some time to acquire a taste for sardines and for a while, I just had to woof them down and try not to taste them so much.  But, after a while, I got used to sardines.  I actually like sardines, now, especially the boneless skinless ones.  So, it has worked out better for me to just eat a can of sardines in olive oil almost every day and then I get some good protein and other nutrients along with plenty of fatty acids and I have less pills to buy and deal with each day.  I have to buy food and eat something, anyway; sardines have become a better value and option for me than krill oil or fish oil pills.

title: HALLELUJAH!!!
body: This is the absolute BEST supplement I have ever taken. I suffer from Chronic Pain (Back) and lymphatic edema in my legs & feet. I have been on massive amounts of medication since 1996 and most of the time I am unable to walk because my legs and feet are so swollen and painful. None of the procedures or medications that the Dr's have given me have helped in any way. I have had several surgeries on my back including a morphine implant pump without relief. Well....., I heard of the Krill tablets and read about how wonderful they were. After doing much research I decided to give them a try. HALLELUJAH!!! within 1 week my legs are no longer swollen and my feet are heeling and not nearly as painful. My back has loosened up to the point of being able to twist from side to side about 20*.( I have been a board for years) I could continue on and on forever but I won't bore you with the horror of it all. I wanted to tell you that this product WORKS and does EVERYTHING it says it will + more. One thing I did different from the instructions was doubling up on the dosage. I just refilled and got the same brand but a higher dose = 1000mg  I WON'T EVER STOP TAKING THIS SUPPLEMENT!!!!!

I'm glad I found this product so I can take an omega-3 supplement that does not affect how I feel. Also, it is good to know that the krill oil is ecologically a good choice as well. If you want to take an omega-3 supplement, I recommend this one over fish oil.

At the time, I noticed a strong/sweet/fishy odor, but, ever the optimist, I proceeded anyway.  After taking this for 2 nights, I had to conclude that the smell really WAS disgusting and that there was no way I was going to be able to stomach taking it.  I removed all the remaining gels of this from my pill boxes, but the sickening odor had strongly permeated all of the other meds, so they are ruined and had to be thrown out. title: It's good for your heart!
body: After a bout with an infestation (that's what it looked like on the MRI) of pulmonary emboli that left my heart damaged, my doctor told me to take at least 1200mg of Fish Oil twice a day, among the other remedies. This was the least invasive.  I'm not going to say that this is what helped my heart the most, but in addition to my pacemaker, I still take 2800mg of Sundown 1400mg and my heart is normal now.  I take mine once a day, 2800mg at once instead of twice a day. The softgel is easier to take than a hard pill or capsule, but it's still a big puppy to take! But I'll keep taking it because of its proven benefits to the heart. Why Sundown/  I trust the brand. That simple. Before your heart has a problem, take fish oil...because it IS good for your heart!

title: MegaRed old product
body: I was disappointed. I originally purchased 2 orders amounting to 220 gel tablets thinking that that would be enough for the next several months. Unfortunately the expiration date was May 2016. I sent back one order because of the date. Also, upon opening one of the bottles that I kept, I noticed that the gels did not have a shine like they usually have when they are fresh. Plus, the coupons enclosed in the package had expired in 2014. Not a good sign and not a good experience and doubt if I will buy them through you again.

title: Smelly Softgels
body: I don't normally write reviews but I hope this may help others.  I first bought this product as a smaller bottle, 65 softgels, 350 mg, exp date 05/2018.  It was a great small clear gel with ABSOLTUELY NO ODOR.  So I purchased the larger 130 softgels size, exp date 10/2017.  When I opened the bottle the fishy smell was overwhelming.  I don't like fish which is one of the reasons I take this product.  I tried to take one but it even tasted like fish.  The first batch had a vanilla flavor and was pleasant.  The good softgels were translucent while the bad smelling gels were matte finish and more round.  I contacted the company who claimed it was due to storage at high temperatures.  They were very responsive and I am returning the bad smelling product and they are sending me coupons to purchase new bottles.  Buyer beware that smelly softgels are a possibility based on storage condions.

title: Great for LASIK patients.
body: I've ordered several of these during the past year as I struggled with dry eye problems as a result of LASIK. I had dry eye issues pre-LASIK, but because of the surgery my issue has worsened. I did some reading and [forgive me, I'm paraphrasing here quite a bit] it turns out that when the corneal flap is opened during LASIK surgery, a nerve that tells your eye when it is dry or moistened is damaged. As a result, artificial tears were all but worthless for the first couple months and I often had to carry around a separate bag just for eyedrops. I also work on a computer so staring at a screen all day long had worsened the problem. I tried everything from regular tears to gel drops to overnight creams and more. I landed on MegaRed's daily supplement as a way to combat the uncomfortable dryness/itchiness. It works wonders. I very rarely experience discomfort in my eyes anymore, and when I do, I realize it's because I forgot my supplement that morning. Highly recommend for those that have gone through LASIK or currently experience some pretty bad dry eye problems!

title: Burp-less!!
body: It is hard to review something like a vitamin or supplement because you can rarely tell if it works as advertised.  It is not like an aspirin or antacid, for example, that gives you results you can feel.  So I generally shy away from reviewing stuff like this.  However, I did want to come back and review the Krill Oil capsules if for no other reason than to let everyone know they really do not have any fishy aftertaste or burpy nastiness.  I used to take omega-3 fish oil capsules from various vendors and inevitably they all had some degree of burpy fishy aftertaste.  Sometimes they upset my stomach making matters worse.

body: I was so pleased to see the price for MegaRed on Amazon.  I have taken these for years and now my husband needs them as well. Things I like best about this product are (1) small size, (2) no "repeat" fishy taste, and (3) the wonderful smell. ( I read a book by Dr. Lendon Smith, Feed Your Body Right, where he explained about supplements.  If a supplement smells really good to you, you probably need it.  If it smells really bad, you either don't need it or you may be allergic to it.)  My doctor recommended Omega-3 for me when I had high cholesterol.  While that is now under control, I continue to hear benefits from taking Omega-3.  Great product.

title: The best thing for painful joints!
body: I started taking this type of fish oil at the suggestion of a friend whose husband's doctor had told him when his hip joints got so painful he could hardly walk to try one or two a day and see if it helped-otherwise go to an orthopedic surgeon.  So I tried them when my right hip was so bad I couldn't do my 30 minute walk for diabetes a day that I needed to.  It started helping in less than a week!  When my local store stopped carrying this exact mix-Omega 3 & 6- I had to go online to find a supply.  It has worked as well as the one I had before.  My only suggestion to consumers and to the seller-don't ship during the hottest part of the summer-it is oil after all!  They survived but barely!

title: 240 capsule size is half the dosage...
body: Well I have to say, I like the product. I initially bought the 60 capsule size to try it out, and I like it well enough, no fishy taste or burps, easy to take, etc... so I figured, I'd stock up and get the 240 cap size... well to my surprise, the dosage is about half what the 60 cap size is per capsule. I see now that its listed in the fine print as a 4 capsule serving size rather than two, but this is not apparent in the main description... these are essentially two different products, and for Amazon to have them listed under the same general listing, with 60, 120, and 240 sizes listd as buying options, it's deceiving. If you're going to sell a different dosage size, it should be listed as a separate product, or at least well marked up in the main description...

title: Highest 5-Star Quality IFOS certified fish oil for the best price.

title: Excellent company, great product
body: Life Extension is one of the tops in their field:  providing products, services, and research to help us keep ourselves healthier.  I've been taking the Life Extension Super Omega-3 product for the past 6+ months and have been able to reduce my triglycerides from 193 to 127 in that time.  I am not saying that this product did all of that -- I've been working on my diet to naturally reduce the triglyceride & VLDL numbers (which, btw, dropped from 39 to 25).  I believe that the combination of diet and this product are responsible for the drop in these numbers from high to normal levels.  (I do not take any Rx meds for cholesterol help.)  From my reading & humble research (I make no claims to be a medical guru), it appears that the 2 most important cholesterol numbers regarding heart disease & stroke risk are the triglycerides and VLDL (LDL & total cholesterol are not as accurate at assessing risk).  This is why I am so excited about these numbers, in particular.

title: I like that the EPA and DHA are molecularlly-distilled from the ...
body: No fishy taste or fishy aftertaste. Very high amounts of EPA and DHA. I like that the EPA and DHA are molecularlly-distilled from the fish oil. A LOT of other fish oil say 1000mg or 1500mg, but that is how much fish oil is in each gelcap. If you look at the label you'll see that only 300mg or so of the 1000mg is actually EPA and DHA and the rest is just fish "junk". Each Life Extension fish oil gelcap contains 1000mg of fish oil which yields 350mg EPA, 250mg DHA, 25mg DPA plus 150mg of olive extract - that's a total of 775mg of good stuff and only 225mg of "junk".

The two bottle are physically the same size, even though the second bottle was twice the count. The only difference in the labels is the count amount and the amount of servings required to get the exact same amount of EPA and DHA, etc. How can that be when you are just buying a bottle with more capsules in it? title: Awesome fish oil
body: We've taken many brands of fish oils and this is by far the best. Our recent blood work has really given us something to cheer about.  My 77-yr-old diabetic father's triglycerides plummeted from the 200s down to the 80s.  His total cholesterol went from the 220s into the 180s over the past 6 months with the addition of this fish oil.  His hs-CRP, homocysteine, and fibrinogen have all improved markedly.  I don't think that he's ever seen numbers this good.  Four years ago when I was a dough-boy at 200 lbs, my triglycerides_to_HDL ratio was a heart-stopping 12.  Now that I've cleaned up my diet, lost the excess weight, and added this fish oil to my daily supplements, my HDL (60) has overtaken my triglycerides (52)!  Everybody is a little different, so please work with your doctor and nutritionist to come up with a workable strategy for you.  Good luck!

title: 240 Capsule Bottle is a Scam
body: I hate it when companies do this--the 240 capsule bottle ($44.40) does not contain more fish oil than the 120 capsule bottle. The dosage for the 120 capsule bottle is 2/day, while the dosage for the 240 capsule bottle is 4/day. The 240 capsules are half as large as the 120 capsules. I don't understand why I was charged more for the same amount of fish oil, in different packaging. What a sham.

title: ... item a few times and thought it was a good, if not excellent deal
body: I've purchased this item a few times and thought it was a good, if not excellent deal. However, the last time I bought it, I noticed on the ingredients that the fish source was no longer anchovy and mackerel but now Alaskan pollock, a fish that has a much lower concentration of omega 3s and is also higher on the food chain. I suppose that the amounts of EPA and DHA indicated on the label are accurate (although there is no government regulation of supplements), but wonder what is going on with choice of fish sourced and whether this influences the possibility of heavy metal or other pollutant contamination. Disturbed that this product was changed without some indication by the manufacturer or on Amazon; the label shown on the Amazon page still indicates "anchovy and mackerel" as the fish sources which, if nothing else, is misleading advertising. I'm switching to a different brand.

title: The additives make the difference
body: I have used this product for years. I have a faulty fatty acid cascade secondary to a prescription drug. This causes some enzymes in the cascade to be upregulated and some to be down regulated. The consequence is no EPA and DHA and below normal levels of dihomogammalinolenic acid. This causes some nervous system and sleep problems. This is the only product that takes care of both the omega 3 and omega 6 problems caused by the faulty cascade. The sesame seed lignans in the product down regulate delta-5-desaturase which lowers arichodontic acid  and causes dihomogammalinolenic acid to reach higher levels and create more prostaglandin E1. This controls the side effect of the drug for which the disease care system has no treatment.

title: Great product, try this test
body: If you take a Styrofoam cup and fill it half-way with water (~4oz), then cut open one of these Omega-3 pills and drop the liquid in the cup; in about 10-15 minutes you'll see the Styrofoam cup start being eaten away and eventually break into two pieces.  This supposedly represents how the product cleans your veins/body of bad cholesterol, etc.  In any case, this product is "approved" by ConsumerLab.com and we find it works well, both my wife and myself.  We have been taking it for years now. The price is reasonable too at $24-$27 bottle.

title: Fish Oil That FINALLY Works For Me!!!
body: Fish oil FINALLY works for me!! I know fish oil is a very basic, very important supplements with a large variety of benefits. But, for many, many years, every fish oil I tried just gave me bad symptoms and no benefits. I also tried kalamari oil (Calamarine), krill oil, palm oil and every other super oil for Omega 3's out there. Nothing worked! I tried this Omega 3 from Life Extension thinking that maybe the olive fruit would stop the oil from going rancid (oxidizing) inside of me and make it work. I am SO glad I didn't quit trying!! This is IT!! It even helps me breath better, something I did not expect. The benefits just keep unfolding every day and I highly recommend this fish oil as the ultimate one. There's no fishy burps or any other bad side effects. Just remember that fish oil thins the blood so make sure you do not stack medicines or supplements that also thin the blood with it and stop taking it at least 3 days before any operation or invasive procedure. Try it!

title: Best Omega-3 Out There

title: This came recommended from a doctor

title: Smaller Capsules In 240 Count Version Not Called Out In Listing
body: This is specifically for the 240 count version of the product. You pay considerably more for the 240 count but get the same amount of product as the 120 count.  This needs to be called out clearly somewhere on the listing or on the product.  They don't even have an image of the nutritional info for the 240 count which would show that the serving size for the 240 count is 2x the number of capsules as the 120 count.  I thought I was getting a good deal when I was actually getting the same amount of product for more money.  Not only that, but now I need to take 8 capsules per day instead of 4 which is a pain.

title: Problems with my last order of this product
body: I have been using this fish oil for a couple of years and felt it was both good quality fish oil and a good value. Never had any problems. Well I recently re-ordered two 240 capsule bottles. The two bottles I received were jam-packed with capsules right to the very top - literally the capsules at the top were flattened by the lid. The capsules were so jam-packed so tightly into the bottle they were stuck together and unusable, there was no way to get them out of the bottle without tearing them. I've returned them to Amazon with absolutely no problem and a refund has been issued. Now I am ordering another brand of fish oil that costs significantly more.On the plus side I notice the new brand I am ordering has a bit more Omega-3 and about half the cholesterol of the Solgar. So I will probably stick with the new brand.

title: Clinical Lab review - why I purchased Natrol
body: The lab ranking for Natrol is B- for this supplement. It is ranked highest for value, label accuracy, and nutritional value. A tad lower on the scale was projected efficacy, product purity and ingredient safety. Overall Natrol is the best bang for the buck and rated well out of the 53 over the counter available fish oil supplements that were clinically tested. The fish oil supplements that were rated higher were much, much more expensive and efficacy was minimally higher.

title: Great overall Value for Omega-3 supplement!  Highly Recommend!
body: I have been using Natrol Omega-3 1000mg gels for several years.  I take it with my oil soluable vitamins (like vitamin D) in the morning and then I take it at night as well.  As it is always hard to tell if any supplement is working, with this fish oil I can tell you that I seem to feel better when I take than when I don't!  My mood and joints seem better when I take it.  I will be staying with Natrol as I feel that it is the right balance of value and quality.  I take my supplements for life.  This one won't break the bank.  To what extent any supplement works needs to be put in context of price.  Natrol has a good solid product here that is well priced.  Highly recommend this Omega-3.

title: A good fish oil supplement
body: I've been taking Natrol Omega-3 Fish Oil since May 2011. I've always heard about how good omega-3 fish oil is, so I decided to try this product. I admit, I had nothing to go on when I first bought this over 2 years ago, except for the reviews here on Amazon. I like how the pills are easy to swallow and have no weird tastes, which are two of the main reasons I bought this. It has a slight lemon flavor so that probably cancels out the fish taste that other brands of fish oil may have. And I've never had any fishy burps. I work out 5-6 days a week and run about 3 times a week.

title: I feel that I sleep better when taking this fish oil though
body: This fish oil definitely has a lemon flavor. If you're not crazy about that "fake" lemon taste, this isn't for you. It's a BIG pill also, which might make it hard for some to swallow. I feel that I sleep better when taking this fish oil though. I take one with breakfast and one with dinner.

I don't understand why none of the fish oil products on amazon contain the EPA/DHA amounts.  If i would have know this before hand, i would have never bought this product.  The EPA/DHA amounts should equal the MG stated on the front of the bottle.  For example, 1000mg of Omega 3 Fish oil should contain something like 600 EPA and 400 DHA or something close to it; even 500/300 would have been a way better ratio.  Try to aim for at least 2/3 and nothing less.

title: Excellent fish oil with no fishy taste
body: In order to improve my HDL, my favorite RN suggested that I start taking fish oil (1000 mg twice a day).  She also suggested the Natrol brand.  I've ordered and used a number of bottles and will continue to do so.  The product is easy to open, easy to take, does not have a fishy after taste, has a pleasing lemony scent (though I note that some reviewers do not like that), and it's helped to improve my HDL.  I am very pleased with this product.

title: Good Supplement
body: A great way to supplement your omega-3 needs. I would recommend taking this with food. I notice that when I don't take them with food I get those "Fish Burps". The soft gels are supposed to be lemon flavored but it doesn't seem to make much difference. I don't blame the product for the burps. I just remember to take them with food. Price is fair when you get it with the free shipping. I think other retailers sell 1000 count bottles of a different brand for only a few dollars more. But I trust Amazon and Natrol.

title: but maybe they're good for other things
body: My daughters pediatrician suffered fish oil for her adhd symptoms.  She doesn't take a stimulant or any type of medication for it.  She's been taking these for one month, and I can't tell a difference, but maybe they're good for other things.

title: No Fishy Taste

title: So much better than the others!!
body: I don't review items often, but this one is worth the effort. After years of taking various fish oil-based omega-3 supplements for arthritis inflammation, I've finally found one that doesn't leave my stomach upset, doesn't taste or smell icky when I'm swallowing it, and doesn't follow up with hours of fish taste or burps. I chose this product recently because of the "no fish burps" reviews, and I agree completely. I'm having the same positive effects, but many fewer of the unpleasant effects that come with "normal" fish oil capsules. I'm so glad I tried this one, and will never go back to the others.

title: Excellent for your Heart
body: I use these for me and my cats. They are excellent for the heart, and I have been using Natrol products so long, I decided that they probably purify this oil as much as possible before packaging it. I don't let my cat's have tuna or salmon because it is so full of carcinogens, but they have to have the fish oil, and I feel this is safe.

title: Hurray, no fishy flavor!
body: A lot of Omega-3 Fish Oil softgels claim to have a lemony flavor or no fishy taste, but this is the only one I've tried for which that's true. I'm allergic to shellfish and found out the hard way, so I'm particularly sensitive to fishy flavors. This is a great product, it really has no fishy taste--and it produces no fishy-tasting burps, which is another problem common to fish oil softgels. I'll continue to buy this product, and if you don't like that fishy taste, try this to up your healthy Omega-3s without also upping your Omega-6s.

title: Best fish oil for the price.
body: *** I WAS NOT COMPENSATED FOR THIS REVIEW. I exchanged my currency for these goods. ***

title: New Chapter has great customer service
body: New Chapter has great customer service. They email back within 24 hours. They told me these are he same as the pregnancy version, just larger tablets. If you don't mind swallowing the size (which it isn't even that big), then it's a much better deal to get these. They have no fishy smell. My husband who hates the smell of fish cracked one open and described them as smelling like good sushi. I've never gotten any burps or bad breathe from these. I'm about 4 months pregnant and I stopped taking them for 5 days and immediately was tired. I couldn't figure it out why I suddenly felt so tired, thought maybe it was just a new pregnancy symptom. But once I took these again, I regained my energy. I did lots of research and these are great quality.

title: The purest fish oil supplement available.
body: I have been taking this supplement for 6 years now on a daily basis.  I started taking it before I got pregnant with my first child.  I've either been pregnant, nursing, or both for almost 6 years now.  I started taking it because I knew that it was recommended for pregnant women to take omega 3 supplements and I decided that this supplement was the purest and healthiest option.  When I am finished nursing I will continue to take this product daily.  My kids are smart kids and it is possible that this supplement may have helped contribute to their intelligence.

title: Great quality fish oil
body: Been buying this for years now! Best fish

title: Great results
body: My cholesterol was 313 two months ago. LDL and triglycerides were bad, so I began taking New Chapter Whole mega fish oil. I just got the results from my recent test and my cholesterol is now 191 with LDL and triglyceride levels all good and within the acceptable range. I know the fish oil had something to do with this. I highly recommend this product!!

title: Great product at a fantastic price!
body: I'm not one to purchase many vitamins/supplements but I decided to check out Amazon to see if they carried New Chapters Wholemega Fish Oil, and to my surprise they do! I've been purchasing these pills for my mom for over a year now and it has made a huge impact in getting rid of inflammation of her joints, knees etc. Nothing else worked "long term", except for this product. I would always purchase this item from Mom's Organic, as they typically offered it at a "reduced price" but recently the price has nearly doubled! I'm super glad to know Amazon carries the same product at a much lower price. It's definitely worth it, and it definitely works. Thanks Amazon!

title: My husband had dry eye and this was recommended to him by his eye doctor
body: My husband had dry eye and this was recommended to him by his eye doctor. He tried other brands because this is expensive, but they did not work. This is the only brand that has worked for his dry eye. He has found that he doesn't need to take it every day, he can get away with taking it every other day to every three days. When he feels his eyes getting dry, he takes one. So that helps the bottle last longer and costs us less. The only thing I personally don't like is I burp up fish oil, my husband does not, but I do. So it probably just depends on the individual. It is worth it to me to take it since it beneficial for my whole body. We are very thankful for this quality product.

title: Great Fish Oil Pills
body: I love these fish oil vitamins. The only slight problem I have with them is they are a little big but if that really bothers you get the prenatal kind.  The servings are the same except they come in for small pills instead of two big pills. The only problem with those is there is only about 22 servings instead of the 30 servings like this one has.

title: Love love love this awesome supplement.😍😘😍😘
body: I know fish oil has so many benefits. Good for inflammation, weight loss, skin, hair and nail . Also make your bone strong . I already finished 3 bottles and going to order again . I hope I'll get free bottle this time for my honest review. Also it's halal.

title: No "fish" burps anymore.
body: The first thing that attracted me to this product was that they explain on the packaging how they process their oil which you don't really get from others. This product also doesn't give me the "fish" burps which I'm sure most of us have had. I don't get any lingering fish taste at all but you can definitely smell it when you open the bottle. I can say that since I've been taking this along with my statin prescription my cholesterol levels are better than with the statin alone.

title: After Taste
body: I bought these to replace another brand that Amazon quit stocking which I really liked. These were a recommended replacement. The only problem is I always burp these up. Even with food they still come back up. Has a metallic after taste. If this continues I'll be looking for a different brand. Too bad I bought 2 bottles.

title: I love this product!
body: I love this product! I want to believe that my BP systolic is approximately 15 points lower and about 8 points lower diastolic. Nails shiner and joints a little less sore.

title: Wouldn't be without this product!
body: I love this product!  I call it my "happy pill".  I have been on different high quality fish oils for a few years.  I knew I should take the fish oil for the health benefits but never noticed anything different when I forgot to take it or when off of it for awhile.  I tried this product because I had a coupon.  Within two weeks, I noticed a huge difference!  I didn't have the mood swings I normally experience with my monthly cycle(which is very significant at our house!) and I seemed to have more energy throughout the day.  I am on quite a vitamin regimin to help combat my PMS symptoms but this is the first time I have seen such an amazing difference.  My whole family agrees that I will not be without this product, so I order this through Amazon's subscribe and save program and save money every month!

title: Read the label before taking!
body: I bought these based upon the good reviews, to supplement my diet with omegas since I am pregnant and not a big fan of eating fish.  At first I would take 2 after breakfast.  Bad idea!  They gave me horrible stomach aches, and I would burp up fishy taste (which I would have not minded nearly as much as the stomach pain).  After that, I decided it would be smart to actually read the label!  Now I take 1 before (or with) my 2 largest meals of the day.  Problem solved.  I have no longer had a stomach ache, nor unpleasant fishy burps.  I can't tell if they make me feel any better or different, but I'm hoping my unborn baby is benefitting from them.  I am not sure if I will reorder these or shop around for another brand.  I do have a very sensitive gag reflex right now, and these pills definitely trigger it when I take them.  They do go down easy though, despite their size.

title: Ingredients Keep Changing

The rest are as follows- Omega 6 was 90mg, is now 60mg. Omega 5,7 & 8 was 100mg, is now 95mg. Omega 3's have remained the same at 120mg. It's a good product but I wish the manufacturer was a bit more consistant with their concentrations.

title: Not worth it
body: I've been taking these vitamins for a few years, and wondered why I never noticed much skin, nail, hair, or mood improvements.  I kept taking them because Omegas are supposed to be so important to our health, but I never could see what the big deal about Omegas 3s was. Recently I began carefully researching omega 3 brands for mood elevation and was surprised how "nothing special" these omegas are.  For starters, it's not on the IFOS chart of omegas, which I would want for my brand (and for the money they cost). And although these are advertised as "1000 mg," that's only at 2 capsules.  Even at 1000 mg, the EPA and DHA levels are lower than what you get from a single capsule of some other brands such as omegavia, nutrigold, omapure, or nordic naturals.  For the money, I'm going to Nutrigold.  Some people may be concerned that Nutrigold and omapure derive their oils from non oily fish (such as cod and white fish), but based on other reviewers 'reports and independent reading, the source of fish oils is less important than the omega 3 levels. So I'm disappointed that I could have been spending my money on a better product all this time and maybe getting some real benefits.  Just something to look into before purchasing based solely on the (otherwise good) New Chapter brand.

title: It Works - Get the detailed facts and don't let the headlines about fish oil sway you
body: These are the best.  I buy their pitch: that 1) fish oil is highly volatile precisely because of its antioxidant qualities, this makes it hard to preserve before you consume it. That 2) the studies that have cast doubt on the value of fish oil have all used oil that was shown to be rancid - so you'd expect it to actually be harmful. Som 3) making fish oil the same way quality cooking oils are made (cold expeller pressed) is the way to get it into your tummy before it spoils.  Duh. Anyway I demonstrated it to my own satisfaction - I took this product for several years, had terrific cholesterol; then got lazy and tapered off of it.  Over the next 18 months (3 tests), cholesterol increased dramatically.  Not to levels that suggested taking statins, but I was clearly on the way.  Went back on these, and at my next test (12 months) - way down again. That's all the proof I need. No I didn't make any other dietary changes.

title: It Works - Get the detailed facts and don't let the headlines about fish oil sway you
body: These are the best.  I buy their pitch: that 1) fish oil is highly volatile precisely because of its antioxidant qualities, this makes it hard to preserve before you consume it. That 2) the studies that have cast doubt on the value of fish oil have all used oil that was shown to be rancid - so you'd expect it to actually be harmful. Som 3) making fish oil the same way quality cooking oils are made (cold expeller pressed) is the way to get it into your tummy before it spoils.  Duh. Anyway I demonstrated it to my own satisfaction - I took this product for several years, had terrific cholesterol; then got lazy and tapered off of it.  Over the next 18 months (3 tests), cholesterol increased dramatically.  Not to levels that suggested taking statins, but I was clearly on the way.  Went back on these, and at my next test (12 months) - way down again. That's all the proof I need. No I didn't make any other dietary changes.
