title: Read the label before taking!
body: I bought these based upon the good reviews, to supplement my diet with omegas since I am pregnant and not a big fan of eating fish.  At first I would take 2 after breakfast.  Bad idea!  They gave me horrible stomach aches, and I would burp up fishy taste (which I would have not minded nearly as much as the stomach pain).  After that, I decided it would be smart to actually read the label!  Now I take 1 before (or with) my 2 largest meals of the day.  Problem solved.  I have no longer had a stomach ache, nor unpleasant fishy burps.  I can't tell if they make me feel any better or different, but I'm hoping my unborn baby is benefitting from them.  I am not sure if I will reorder these or shop around for another brand.  I do have a very sensitive gag reflex right now, and these pills definitely trigger it when I take them.  They do go down easy though, despite their size.

title: Brain and Heart Health! (may be cheaper elsewhere)
body: Do yourself a favor and start a habit today of regularly supplementing with fish oil . But... Shop around.  I love omegas and fish oils and I am a huge advocate for the overall health benefits of this product, but there are other high quality oils on the market for less. New Chapter claims the rich goldne-red color of the oil is testament to it's quality. I bought the Trader Joe's version (much cheaper) and compared the oils on white paper. There is no discernable difference in color and both seem to use wild caught alaskan salmon. I have bought lower quality versions of salmon oil or cod oil in the past, but New Chapter isn't the only company to use high quality oil. That said, I don't regret my purchase, still an outstanding product and worth every penny if you don't have access to any alternatives.

title: Brain and Heart Health! (may be cheaper elsewhere)
body: Do yourself a favor and start a habit today of regularly supplementing with fish oil . But... Shop around.  I love omegas and fish oils and I am a huge advocate for the overall health benefits of this product, but there are other high quality oils on the market for less. New Chapter claims the rich goldne-red color of the oil is testament to it's quality. I bought the Trader Joe's version (much cheaper) and compared the oils on white paper. There is no discernable difference in color and both seem to use wild caught alaskan salmon. I have bought lower quality versions of salmon oil or cod oil in the past, but New Chapter isn't the only company to use high quality oil. That said, I don't regret my purchase, still an outstanding product and worth every penny if you don't have access to any alternatives.

title: Belches from Hell
body: I bought these as part of me trying to heal a cavity, along with a remineralizing toothpaste and oil pulling. These pills as super easy to swallow, and I think they would help but the problem I had was I got terrible - I mean TERRIBLE belching from these. It smelled like sulfur, and it hurt my chest and mouth coming out. It took three days after stopping the pills for it to go away, in which time I was miserable and I made everyone around me miserable when I couldn't control the horrible smell from the belching. I may just have had a reaction to it, so if you've taken cod liver oil before with no issue, you should be fine, the pills were very easy to take, and I like the bottle top, but just be aware otherwise, if you don't know how it affects you.

It keeps them healthy and seems to have a good efffect on keeping their coats silky and shiney.  The main reason I tak e fish oil daily are for the heart health benefits.  My doctor takes 4 a day and his cardiologist takes 6 a day if that ells you anything.  UNfortunately I do not have their budget so Ill go with two  :)

title: RATED A BEST BUY
body: The most difficult item to review has to be one of the many supplement products, which never give you the immediate feedback such that you can say "Brand X sure makes me feel much better within two hours."  There is so much hype and price markup in vitamins, and the multi-level priced items cost an arm and a leg.  I finally gave up and joined an independent lab rating service (ConsumerLab) and they test products to see if they are labelled correctly, and give excellent reviews of things to look for when evaluating such things as probiotics.  To make a long story short, Kirkland rates as a best buy in many categories, including Omega-3.  I have read that Dr. Tobias has high ratings from another lab, but they are not rated by ConsumerLab.  There is so much out there it is almost impossible to be through.  I can say that Kirkland (made by Costco) is a very reliable and economical choice.

title: Get rid of two problems for the price of one
body: I started to take Kirkland Omega-3 Fish Oil together with Red Yeast Rice in order to low my cholesterol level naturally. And what did I noticed?

title: No fishy burps
body: I have been using this fish oil for a couple of months now on my Doctor's recommendation.  She specifically recommended Kirkland as one brand to look into.  I have noticed that my skin and hair a little bit oilier after using this product, which leads me to believe that the product is getting into my system.  I do not freeze mine as some people recommend to avoid fishy burps, and I have not dealt with fishy burps at all.  I am hoping to see some improvement in my triglyceride numbers at my next blood test.

title: Best Fish Oil On Amazon
body: This is hands-down your best value and quality for fish oil on Amazon in my opinion. I researched heavily in selecting the brand I wanted and this Costco brand (Kirkland is their in-house brand) has some of the best reviews from supplement websites I found. The value is great and you get a ton of pills here.

title: Works Great For Dry Eye Relief
body: I was hesitant to buy these because, I did not know how potent they were but, I am very happy to say they they work for the purpose that I purchased them. I have very dry eyes and, I usually put castor oil in my eyes...Yes directly into my eyes. I have read that taking Fish Oil will help with producing oil in your eyes. (Many people don't know that your eyes have a lipid layer that is made of Water, Oil and, Mucus...If your body does not produce enough oil in your eyes it will cause dry eyes). Well I have stopped putting castor oil in my eyes because, I wanted to see if these worked. After about the 3rd day I can feel a great diffrence in my eyes. When I wake up my eyes are white and, moist. (My right eye is really white but, my left eye is still a bit veiny...not red just that you can see red veins). If you have dry eyes this is a must in order to get your eyes to be healthy and, moist.

title: Great product, helped my dog's skin/coat considerably
body: I'm very happy with this purchase. I bought this to give to my dog, a collie. He has some skin and coat issues, and I find that putting fish oil in his foot really helps his coat. The serving size is two pills per day. What I generally do is prick the soft gel pill with a safety pin and squeeze the oil on top of his food. He likes the taste, and it's much easier than trying to toss these large sized pills down this throat. This is also a really great price for the amount of pills I get. The bottle is huge. I give him two pills a day (sometimes one, but usually two) so this bottle lasts almost a year. I'm very happy with this product. I have ordered Kirkland vitamins before. This is something to consider if your dog has skin issues. I also changed his food to a better quality product that has meat as a first ingredient and doesn't contain corn, wheat or soy. Changing his food and including fish oil in his diet has dramatically improved his quality of life. He used to spend a LOT of time itching and he had horrible dandruff. Now he's happy, healthy and dandruff free.

title: HDL cholesterol
body: If  doctors recommend 1000 to 1200 mg of fish oil because that amount of fish oil contains the total amount of omega-3s the doctor wants you to consume. One thousand or 1200 mg of fish oil doesn't equal 1000 or 1200 mg of omega-3s. The average 1000 mg fish oil softgel typically provides around 300 mg of omega-3s (even less of the important EPA and DHA), and so in order to meet the 500 mg intake guidelines, a minimum of two softgels would be necessary.

title: Don't be like me and buy it just based on the price
body: The advertised dose of 1000mg is for "total fish oils". The dose of Omega-3s, the oils you actually want, is only 300mg. Not only are you not getting as much of the healthy fats as you might think from their advertising, ratio matters so all the other, non-Omega-3s in this pill might actually be hurting you.

title: Seems good to me.
body: The gell caps are easy to swallow even though they are fairly large.  No odd taste or smell that I can notice.  Some people complain of "fish burps" with fish oils - I've never tried other oil to compare it to, but I've never had any issue with these.

title: very satisfied. I was surprised when the bottles arrived at ...
body: very satisfied. I was surprised when the bottles arrived at how large they were - can't complain.  As expected, the Kirkland brand (Cosco) delivers the best of the best! Liquid capsules are crystal clear and have NO fishy aftertaste!Don't take high doses unless you check with your doctor, or if you are allergic to fish.

title: Essential Ingredients, Great Quality, Great Value
body: I have always been impressed with Kirkland products, and this one is no exception.  Kirkland is the store brand of Costco, which carries products that tend to higher-end and higher quality than clubs like Sam's Club, to begin with.  The Kirkland brand products are designed and manufactured to be of slightly better or much better quality than the name brand - and with a typically much lower price.  I have never have a problem with any Kirkland Signature brand products, including this one.

title: A GREAT DEAL
body: A great deal on a whole lot of fish oil.  I give two a day to my older dogs. Combined with a glucosamine supplement it I could really see the difference. My dogs are 200 pounds with some arthritis and they are now running around like they did years before.  Note: I searched ebay and amazon for a good priced chewable supplement for dogs and found most are a huge ripoff. Today at Walmart found a huge bottle of the store brand for under ten dollars and they have 500 mg of glucosamine per pill, much more than the others.  I take glucosamine but not the condroiten myself since I am a vegetarian. Condroiten is made from cows and glucosamine is made from shellfish unless you specifically get the Hsi glucosamine which is fermented (non animal). Also be sure to take msm (sulfer) with glucosamine or it won't work well. They add it to some supplements and I think you can buy it separately as well.

title: GREAT BANG FOR YOUR BUCK
body: This stuff lasts forever, lol.  I buy one a year and it lasts ALL YEAR! I generally take one a day and they go down easy despite the large size of the liquicap.  My dad recommended these to me when I was told I had high cholesterol by my doc.  A year later, cholesterol is normal.  Mind you, I was on statins and also supplementing flush-free Naicin.  Still, great bang for your buck.

title: second only to coffee as an essential at our house
body: I started taking fish oil several years ago with vague hopes that it would be good for me. The remarkable results I had (after months, and after increasing my dose to four capsules a day) were: 1. my middle-aged constant hip and lower back pain completely disappeared, and 2. I went from having nagging (but not terrible) headaches every day for *30 years* to having one headache a year (so Tylenol budget is now zero). I chose Kirkland because it was the cheapest I could find. (It is about $10 a bottle at Costco, but that means you have to endure shopping at Costco, which I despise.) Some people are scared of fish-oil burps. After maybe three days, I adjusted and have never had them since.

title: Great product!
body: This is my second bottle of fish oil that I bought from them I think they are legitimately selling a good product .  I called the company and spoke to a woman who was very knowledgeable about the item ...she answered all my questions about how these capsules are made and What fish is inside and where the fish comes from !!! I recommend it highly!

title: Seems to help
body: My vet recommended this for my senior dog to help with his coat. I've been giving him this product for several months and have noticed a change in his coat. It is shinier and he does not seem to shed as much as he did. I thought I would give it a try for myself. So when he gets his capsule, I get mine. I don't know if there have been any changes to me, but I do not seem to "shed" as much as I was.

title: Great quality, very low price -- why buy another brand?!
body: I don't like eating fish (other than tuna steaks), so I take a fish oil supplement. I chose Kirkland because of their top-notch purity (as analyzed by Men's Health) and their low price. It's the cheapest and one of the best -- why would I get anything else?

title: My Newfoundland Loves them.
body: I used to take this brand of Fish Oil until the package got warm during the summer and all the capsules molded into one. I now give this brand to my dog daily which her vet recommended and will continue to buy them for her. They are in-expensive and she loves the taste when she bites and pops them open. When I was taking them I often would have a burpy after taste.  I switched to Barleans organic orange flavor fish oil for myself and I have never had that after taste and they never have become attached to each other. I will continue to buy Barleans for myself.

title: Brought down my cholesterol numbers!
body: I have high cholesterol and my Dr recommended I take fish oil as well as adjust my diet and exercise. Since I started taking fish oil I have seen a great improvement in my Cholesterol count. When I maintain a certain diet and exercise level with the fish oil my cholesterol numbers are good :)

title: My dog and myself
body: I give two a day to my 100lb American bulldog. When she was a puppy, and big enough, she got one of these a day. This insured that she was getting dha in her diet for her puppy brain as well as a reduction in her shredded fur. I keep her on it for of course heart health as well as, her coat is much softer and stays healthier so that I can bathe her more frequently. Her nails grow stronger and a little bit faster but this is a sign of health and I'll gladly trim her nails more!

title: No Fish Burps--But Don't Stand Behind Me! (Just Joking)
body: I'm probably like a lot of people and don't get enough fish in my diet.  No one in my family likes seafood, except me, so I even hesitate to order it when we go out to eat.  Because of this, and knowing that I have a lack of good cholesterol, I decided to buy this popular item based on the customer reviews.  I also want to compare my current blood test it to my next test to determine if there are any improvements.

title: I totally stand by these!
body: I acquired these some months ago in an attempt to see if this supplement would benefit me and I was overjoyed when I found out they did work well. Over the first month I noticed a slight difference in heart rate (dropped 10 points) and from then on out just steadily continued to go down. As it went down I noticed that I felt better and I could perform better, pertaining to how my heart was working more efficiently. Definitely a good buy!

title: Where's the fish burp?
body: I heard a lot about the "fish burp" but I've been taking it for three weeks now and nada. Whew. I never liked seafood so I thought taking the fish oil should substitute the missing nutrients but I was worried to death about those burps but with a lots of luck, that did not happen.

title: This is wonderful. I started taking 4 softgels a day for ...
body: I started taking these about 2 months and a half ago, this is my first time taking a supplement regularly and I will continue doing this as long as I live. When I got my first period I realized I did not get any cramps and also my migraines have disappeared. This is wonderful. I started taking 4 softgels a day for the first 30 days so that it will build up in my body, then I decreased to 2 a day, I usually take them in the morning with breakfast and at night with dinner. I recommend this 100%, it has done wonders with me.

title: Decent purchase/Big Pill to swallow
body: I actually purchased these for my dog (boxer) to improve his dry skin.  It does work for him but I was taken back by the enormous size of this pill.  If I had to take this pill I don't think I could/would, and it is recommended that you should take 3 pills a day.  It is much larger than previous fish oil supplements I have purchased for him.  Of coarse he has no problems swallowing them down!  I think for the money this supplement is a decent purchase but just be aware the pills are pretty big.

title: i' am giving it 1 star because there's not a ...
body: i' am giving it 1 star because there's not a zero star options. Kirkland fish oil is an inferior product. very inferior with inaccurate labeling. the DHA and EPA content together is 250, 250 thats a freakin joke and it doesnt even tell you the count for each. all you know it can be 125-125 or 200-50. for those who don't anything fish oil the EPA and DHA is what you want. and Kirkland as the lowest count i've ever seen. stick to nature made, or bodyvega anything but kirkland's. 0 stars

title: Too big
body: Product is good but I stopped taking it because they are so big.

title: Kirkland Signature Omega-3 Fish Oil Concentrate, 400 Softgels, 1000 mg
body: Buying this size is a great value as compared to buying several smaller bottles.  My husband and male German Shepherd both take four of these daily. Our Shepherd's coat of hair was too thin, according to our vet but the situation has been rectified after six months of these Softgels which we will continue to give him.  Since packaging is a large part of the cost of health supplements, it is usually more cost-effective to find the largest bottle that will suit your needs, keeping in mind the Best Used By date on the bottle.  Even with shipping, this size (400 softgels) cost much less than buying smaller bottles locally of other brands even on sale (BOGO).  This was an amazon.com affiliate purchase.

Its healthy for all my dogs and has really helped with the allergies of the one. It's great for reducing cholesterol in humans too so I take it as well.  Very good product!

title: Five Stars
body: I take Fish Oil religiously to keep my Cholesterol level under control.

title: Raised my good cholesterol up !!!
body: Along with other good things that Kirkland Fish Oil With Omega 3 has done, it has raised my good cholesterol up. My HDL Cholesterol went from 27 to 37. My doctor was surprised that I raised it up, due to the fact that it's so hard to do. When I told her that I was taking fish oil with Omega 3, she said it was definitely the fish oil. Thanks Kirkland for a good product at a great price !!

title: Good Buy
body: High number of capsules for a low price

title: This brand works!
body: I have always felt that Kirkland Fish Oil was a consistently good product, but always wondered if it really was doing any good. My husband, myself, and our aging lab/mix dog all take this along with the Kirkland Glucosamine. While on vacation, our dog ran out because I didn't pack enough for him while we were gone. When we got back home, the pet sitter told us he had just started limping--the day after he ran out! I got some more in, and within days of getting back on the regiment of Fish Oil and Glucosamine, he is no longer limping. He is playful and acting like a puppy again. According to our vet's recommendation, we give him 3000 mg. of Fish Oil and 1500 mg. Glucosamine. He weighs 90 pounds. My husband and I take the same dosage, and my cholesterol always tests low.

title: Saw a couple reviews of people burping up fishy taste ...
body: Saw a couple reviews of people burping up fishy taste, have not had that problem after taking every day for the last couple months. Crucial supplement for those of us that do not have an incredibly balanced diet.

title: I wanted to give this one a go because it seemed like a good value
body: I have used different brands of fish oil for years now. I wanted to give this one a go because it seemed like a good value. However, every time I took a pill about 15 minutes later my face would get red and spotty. Not sure what ingredient they put in this fish oil but beware.

title: Two Stars
body: tastes like fish after taking it

title: Great fish oil for joint health!!
body: This is now my second bottle of this fish oil and I will forever buy this. I was diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis about two years ago and heard that fish oil would help with joint pain. Ever since I started taking these pills I've notice my bones do not hurt as much, almost as if this fish oil is lubricating my joints! Besides all the other benefits it's giving my body I can't see why anyone would be on fish oil! I only take one pill a day and that's enough for me, I used to take two but I might have been over killing it, sometimes if I am in a lot of pain or feel stiff I'll take two and it will help relieve it! You can't beat the price for how many your getting, I love that!

title: GREAT BANG FOR YOUR BUCK
body: This stuff lasts forever, lol.  I buy one a year and it lasts ALL YEAR! I generally take one a day and they go down easy despite the large size of the liquicap.  My dad recommended these to me when I was told I had high cholesterol by my doc.  A year later, cholesterol is normal.  Mind you, I was on statins and also supplementing flush-free Naicin.  Still, great bang for your buck.

title: Great product!

I called the company and spoke to a woman who was very knowledgeable about the item ...she answered all my questions about how these capsules are made and What fish is inside and where the fish comes from !!! I recommend it highly!

body: I have had problems with other fish oils making me feel sick after taking them. Kirkland's fish oil doesn't bother me at all. There are no burps and no fishy smells coming after taking these pills. I will continue taking them.

title: Incredible Supplement for Lupus
body: I was ordered by my doctor in 1998 to take 4,000mgs of either fish oil or flaxseed oil every day for the rest of my life to keep down the inflammation of lupus on my joints and organs. I usually buy Nature Made if it's on sale or buy one get one free.

title: Costco sells them for $9

title: worked for my dog
body: We actually got this for our dog, who has sensitive skin.  His coat is glossier, and he hasn't had any issues since we started him on this fish oil.  I can't speak for how it works on humans, but it helped my dog out!

body: Smells like fish every time you open up the bottle. One good thing about it is that you don't taste it.

title: second only to coffee as an essential at our house
body: I started taking fish oil several years ago with vague hopes that it would be good for me. The remarkable results I had (after months, and after increasing my dose to four capsules a day) were: 1. my middle-aged constant hip and lower back pain completely disappeared, and 2. I went from having nagging (but not terrible) headaches every day for *30 years* to having one headache a year (so Tylenol budget is now zero). I chose Kirkland because it was the cheapest I could find. (It is about $10 a bottle at Costco, but that means you have to endure shopping at Costco, which I despise.) Some people are scared of fish-oil burps. After maybe three days, I adjusted and have never had them since.

title: HDL cholesterol
body: If  doctors recommend 1000 to 1200 mg of fish oil because that amount of fish oil contains the total amount of omega-3s the doctor wants you to consume. One thousand or 1200 mg of fish oil doesn't equal 1000 or 1200 mg of omega-3s. The average 1000 mg fish oil softgel typically provides around 300 mg of omega-3s (even less of the important EPA and DHA), and so in order to meet the 500 mg intake guidelines, a minimum of two softgels would be necessary.

title: Consistent quality and appearance
body: I take one a day and have a bottle at home and at work, so these last me more than a year.  I notice no difference between the first capsule and the last, so they seem to be fresh and have a solid shelf life (there is also an expiration date, which is more than a year in the future).

title: Omega 3 fatty acids are good for your good cholesterol numbers
body: Blood result confirmed this supplement did what it claimed to do. Good cholesterol blood levels way high which offsets the normal Highs my results always show.

title: I would like to see some independent testing of this product to ...
body: The fish oil has a very strong odor, which likely means it's rancid/oxidized. For those that are unaware, oxidized fish oils can be very detrimental to your health.

title: Great product, nice large volume
body: I love this product.  The package is large so I don't have to reorder frequently.  Price is excellent and product works great.  Helps with my joints.

title: Good value
body: Have had good experience with Kirkland supplements.  The bulk size makes them very economical compared to the typical small size containers which is good with products used constantly such as supplements.  I use several of these large size Kirkland products.  Have never been disappointed.

title: positive results for Omega-3, Niacin, exercise and reduced diet
body: In 2011, my doctor was concerned with my HDL and triglyceride levels which were considered unhealthly.  My HDL was 30 (needs to be over 40 to be considered good) and my triglyceride level was 336 (needs to be under 150 to be considered good). My total cholesterol was 181 (needs to be under 200 to be good). My lifestyle is 95% sitting, mostly fastfood meals, no exercise and I was probably eating 4,000 calories a day.  My weight was 190 (I am 5'10") in 2011.  My doctor told me to stop eating out, start exercising and take omega-3 pills and niacin each day.

title: Quality fish oil

title: No enertic coating
body: The price was right for this fish oil purchase. However, I probably skimmed the information too quickly. 300 mg of omega-3 is good and pretty typical these days. Getting omega-3 from fish is a great way to do so, but I don't like fish. I won't eat it, can't stand the smell of it cooking, and often walk out of seafood restaurants if the smell is too great. So for me, having that enertic coating is a must. For those who don't know, the enertic coating allows the pill (and therefore the fish oil) to pass through your stomach and into your small intestines. This allows for digestion to occur there rather than the stomach and effectively eliminates fish-burps and other fishy nastiness.

title: For the Omega-3's
body: Please know that only 1/3 of each pill is Omega-3 fatty acids (why most people buy this). This means you have to take 3 pills per day to reach the daily value of 1000mg.

title: Saved my mother
body: Where to begin... first off, my mom had a lot of issues with tumors and was prescribed to use stereoids. Few months down the line she was told by an European physician that she should get "fish oil only" Omega-3 acids, and as a recommendation came Kirkland Signature Fish Oil as "the best in the market". Given that Kirkland was not available in Croatia, I ordered it through Amazon and shipped off to Europe. After six months of therapy using nothing else but this product (6 gels a day), my mother fully recovered.

title: Not as good as once thought...
body: I had believed these were fantastic, especially considering the price. However, after reading the January 2012 issue of Consumer Reports, I learned that the Kirkland brand of fish oil pills did not meet the enteric-coating claim. Apparently, these can prematurely dissolve in your stomach instead of the small intestine, so you won't be receiving the full benefits. I'm switching to another brand which does meet the standards.

title: Kirkland  Fish Oil
body: I'm pleased with Kirkland's products especially the Kirkland Signature Natural

title: watch out for rancid oil in capsules
body: Be sure to check the sell by date.  Fish oil does not have a very long shelf life.  Fresh fish oil has a light lemony smell which fades quickly as the oil ages.

title: A lot of great fish oil tablets in this big bottle
body: There are 400 tablets in this big bottle, and so it's an awesome deal. This fish oil worked for me, mostly as an appetite suppressant. Your body needs oils, and if you don't get enough oils, then eventually you won't be able to control your hunger urges, and most of the time you'll crave desserts and stuff yourself on things that make you gain a lot of weight. Well, that's what happens for me.

title: Great product, helped my dog's skin/coat considerably
body: I'm very happy with this purchase. I bought this to give to my dog, a collie. He has some skin and coat issues, and I find that putting fish oil in his foot really helps his coat. The serving size is two pills per day. What I generally do is prick the soft gel pill with a safety pin and squeeze the oil on top of his food. He likes the taste, and it's much easier than trying to toss these large sized pills down this throat. This is also a really great price for the amount of pills I get. The bottle is huge. I give him two pills a day (sometimes one, but usually two) so this bottle lasts almost a year. I'm very happy with this product. I have ordered Kirkland vitamins before. This is something to consider if your dog has skin issues. I also changed his food to a better quality product that has meat as a first ingredient and doesn't contain corn, wheat or soy. Changing his food and including fish oil in his diet has dramatically improved his quality of life. He used to spend a LOT of time itching and he had horrible dandruff. Now he's happy, healthy and dandruff free.

title: Great for pets! Cats & dog have shinier, healthier coat

American diets typically are very low in omega-3 fats and a fish oil supplement helps to combat this. Also, I have found that my acne is far worse when I don't take this supplement.

My husband, myself, and our aging lab/mix dog all take this along with the Kirkland Glucosamine. While on vacation, our dog ran out because I didn't pack enough for him while we were gone. When we got back home, the pet sitter told us he had just started limping--the day after he ran out! I got some more in, and within days of getting back on the regiment of Fish Oil and Glucosamine, he is no longer limping. He is playful and acting like a puppy again. According to our vet's recommendation, we give him 3000 mg. of Fish Oil and 1500 mg. Glucosamine. He weighs 90 pounds. My husband and I take the same dosage, and my cholesterol always tests low.

title: Smell like fish
body: I figure that since I’m getting older I should atone for all the crap I’ve put into my body through the years.  I’ve heard a lot of good stuff about Fish Oil, but now the professionals are saying none of it’s true.  Like how eggs used to be bad for you, but now they’re good for you again, or did they already switch back to being bad since I’ve been typing this???  Who really knows what’s good and what’s bad?  I guess I just figure that fish are good to eat (aside from the mercury) so why not put some in a pill and swallow it?  I’m game!  This is my third different brand of Fish Oil and this one is by far the worst smelling.  With the other brands, I could stick my nose right in the bottle and not smell anything but the little capsules they use.  These suckers stink let me tell you, but who knows… maybe that means they’re more nutritious?  All that aside, I take these just about every day and only time will tell if my money is well spent or not.

title: Nothing fancy, but great quality
body: I've always been a fan of Kirkland products since I started going to Costco... it's just more convenient to order my fish oil online rather than going down to the store, waiting in line, etc. This is my second bottle and I have had no issues with it. I take fish oil daily and have noticed a significant improvement in my memory and "alertness" - sometimes my mind can get a little "foggy" especially when I'm tired, didn't sleep well, etc. I feel like I function better when I am on fish oil. It also supplements my diet as I am an avid gym junkie. You can't go wrong with the price - $12 bucks for 400, if you take 4 a day (recommended is 4-6, unless you supplement your OMEGA-3's with nuts like I do), it'll last you around 3 months.

title: They are great! - even for your skin
body: I started taking these pills because somehow I found a blog that was talking about the benefits of fish oil. I don't have any problems with my cholesterol, heart or blood pressure, but it's better to prevent those in the first place, so I thought I would give it a try. Still, I wouldn't have known if it works or not, if it wasn't for my skin. I actually started having problems with my skin (mostly breakouts) about a year ago and I tried a bunch of different skin products from cheap to expensive - nothing worked. Then I started taking these, and I don't even really need skin products anymore. Definitely worth it.

title: so good for hair and skin
body: Fish oil is so good for hair and skin. Did you know it prevents dandruff? - Fish oil moisturizes the scalp from within. My daughter and I both take these supplements. We have improved skin, and very little dandruff. When you hear about Omega 3, it is fish oil! Many people don't eat enough fish, or they don't like it. This bottle comes with 400 count - enough for a whole year, if taken daily! These are softgels and easy to swallow. Some people complain about the fishy burp after taking omega 3. We take ours before bed and they digest well. No burp or aftertaste.

title: Smell like fish
body: I figure that since I’m getting older I should atone for all the crap I’ve put into my body through the years.  I’ve heard a lot of good stuff about Fish Oil, but now the professionals are saying none of it’s true.  Like how eggs used to be bad for you, but now they’re good for you again, or did they already switch back to being bad since I’ve been typing this???  Who really knows what’s good and what’s bad?  I guess I just figure that fish are good to eat (aside from the mercury) so why not put some in a pill and swallow it?  I’m game!  This is my third different brand of Fish Oil and this one is by far the worst smelling.  With the other brands, I could stick my nose right in the bottle and not smell anything but the little capsules they use.  These suckers stink let me tell you, but who knows… maybe that means they’re more nutritious?  All that aside, I take these just about every day and only time will tell if my money is well spent or not.

title: Got them for my Dog for her Arthritis
body: My dog,at 80-pounds and 9-years old, is starting to move more slowly.  After reading potential remedies (i.e. Rimidyl), I decided to go with the least side-effects and give her 2 fish oil caplets a day.  SHE LOVES THEM!  I cut them and squirt the oil over her dry food.  The first time she checked it out for a couple of moments and then started eating.  Now she thinks the fish iol is a treat.  Hopefully this will reduce some of the swelling (and with it any pain) she is experiencing from getting older. Will know in a couple of weeks if/when she starts getting up and laying down with less effort.  Regardless, she loves this fish oil.

body: I bought this bottle nearly a year and a half ago, and it still has not expired.  All 400 gelcaps were undamaged, with no significant smell from the bottle.  Taking 2-3g of fish oil a day takes a few days to get used to, you might "burp" a fishy smell once in a while, but no complaints on this cheap source of Omega-3s

title: Fish Oil
body: I am not sure if anyone can tell a quality difference between this and other fish oil supplements since you just swallow them. I have never had any digestive problems for these and my doctor informed me they aid in middle brain development; so I'm guessing my middle brain is very healthy now as I have almost finished the bottle. Joking aside, my doctor said there have been studies in children that link a lack of Omega 3's to Attention Deficit Disorder due to lower middle brain development. Apparently processing foods usually removes nutrients such as Omega 3 fatty acids and since kids in the US are eating mainly heavily processed foods, they aren't getting enough, thus the ADHD. I am not worried about ADHD, but if you are into fitness, these fatty acids also are very helpful in the recovery phase after lifting. I have experienced this benefit and will attest to its viability. I usually take a couple capsules in the morning with my breakfast and sometimes one or two at night if I think of it. I bought the Kirkland brand because I read somewhere that their source is higher quality and contains less crap than other brands (mercury, etc).

title: Good Value, Good Quality
body: I've had major side effects from various prescription statin drugs, diet and exercise alone hadn't reduced my cholesterol either. The addition of fish oil has helped reduce my cholesterol issues. I'm happy with these because there is no yeast or gluten, only wish they'd replace the soy component. title: Number 1, Grade A Product
body: This has always been for me, essentially a real fine product. My numbers, (Cholesterol and BP) have all been improved dramatically. Even my family doctor was amazed at the results I am experiencing. I highly recommend this product if an individual is in need of it. A word about ordering from Amazon and paying Amazon's prices. In reference to another post, an individual was astounded at the difference in pricing between Costco and Amazon. Sure, you may pay a little more here at Amazon, however, I do not have to drive all the way to Costco (about 18 miles round trip), then search for some time to find a parking place and then enter into the abyss. Costco is constantly crowded with rude, ignorant and smelly people. After I locate what I need, I have to go stand in a long line forever, and behind rude, ignorant and smelly people. Then I have to carry my own order out to the car, and then drive home. With free shipping from Amazon., it more than pays to not have burn fuel, put up with traffic and a lot of rude, ignorant and smelly people. We are only talking about a dollar or so price difference. Great product, great price and as always, great shipping time and customer service. Thanks for reading,

title: Helping with my Eyes
body: I've had problems with my eyes the last couple weeks, from all of my allergies that the summer is bringing in. I've been taking these for a week now and can already see a difference, and awesome value per softgel. Also protecting my heart for the future.

title: Insane value, but some quality control issues
body: I bought this for myself because my doctor lectured me on my cholesterol.  I'm only 30, so I figured I was too young to be on perscription cholesterol medication... thus, I'm now taking fish oil 2x daily.  Most of the capsules out there recommend 3x daily, but I always seem to forget lunch.  These don't taste overly fishy.  They're large but go down easy.  One or two capsules burst open and made the others stick to each other such that I have to bang the container to separate them.  Once I dropped a pill on the floor and my dog nabbed it before I could pick it up.  Turns out my dogs (American Bulldogs) absolutely love these things.  Now, when they hear me open the container, they dart to come have some fish oil pills.  After some research, I see that they're actually great for dogs.  Since mine love these, I can even give them as treats.  Certainly more affordable than pump bottle fish oil canine solutions.  Since then, I've ordered myself a fish oil of slightly higher quality, but reordered this for my dogs.  It's supposed to help with their coat, sensitive skin, and general allergies.

title: No fishy taste
body: This is the first fish oil I've tried that doesn't make me burp fish taste even when taking four at a time. That includes other purified versions. Great!

title: I'm Hooked On This Fish Oil
body: My cardiologist recommended I take fish oil and handed me a sheet which listed various bands and the price cost per month. Lovaza the brand recommended had 465 mg EPA - 375 mg DHA per pill (4 pills are recommend per day). Sounds like a lot to me, guess someone has to keep Pharma in business. Nature's Answer on the other hand has 650 mg EPA - 450 mg DHA per tsp and a lot less expensive.

title: Great choice for improving cholesterol!
body: I am using this for about 8 months, my cholesterol numbers improved a lot, especially the ratio of good to bad cholesterol.  Best if taked with food, this helps also getting used to the taste (that is not too bad).  As a chemical professional, I can attest that the processing by molecular distillation is very effective in removing/reducing any mercury or other contamination, and separating the desired types of fat (oil) molecules.  Comparing with other brands I found this one to have one of the highest contents of desirable omega 3 oils for a lower price per ounce.  Good choice!

title: Good for kids
body: My children have used this for years, and they never complain about the taste.

title: REALLY DISGUSTING
body: This is disgusting. This consistency made me want to throw up. It is a thick oil like consistency like regular oil such as Vitamin E oil.It doesn't taste fishy instead it has a really strange and disgusting taste I can't quite describe. There is a tiny hint of orange, but it does not taste like it nor really smell like it, you can kinda smell it, but the other odor overpowers. Would not recommend.

title: Excellent quality & value
body: This is an exceptional value for deep sea fish oil. Tastes like citrus, no fishy aftertaste. The company Nature's Answer is the real deal. I emailed them on a Sunday with a question and I get a response back an hour later from one of their staff RN, PHDs.

title: Three Stars
body: there are better products for the same money

title: Good item, great price.
body: Yes this is orange flavored, but at this price it is hard to find another oil with the same ratios of DHA and EPA. I've not had any "fish burps" with this product since I started using it about 8 months ago. The orange flavor is not overpowering, but will help if you dislike the taste of plain fish oils. I have yet to find something of better value.

title: Long lasting
body: I use liquid fish oil in my home-made dog food and they really seem to love the taste of this stuff. Great value for how long this bottle lasts.

title: Fast, Cheap, and Effective ... you get all three!
body: Golly, this is good stuff.

title: Fish Oil 101... what you need to know... This stuff is a little scary, even!
body: Excellent fish oil, great price, recommended.

title: Don't take straight- froth into water and you'll love this stuff!
body: My first experience with this was awful. Then I figured out the trick! Don't give up until you try this or something similar lol.

title: I don't love the flavor.
body: I grow a variety of citrus trees, and I can assure you this product tastes nothing like any citrus that I grow. I can definitely taste the relationship, but be warned this item falls in the "not delicious" range, which is just above "bad". The positives are that it's a much better sources of Omega 3s  in comparison to similar amounts of pills.

title: Great for the dogs coats
body: My Vet recommended fish oil to alleviate the dryness in our pet's coats. After a couple of weeks there is a noticeable improvement using this product. Had tried the capsules in the past, but the dogs were not interested. I use an eye dropper for precise dosage over their food. Problem solved. Big bottle should last a long time.

title: Helps with acne
body: I started taking Nature's Answer omega-3 for my acne about 4 months ago. I had 5 painful cysts on my face the very day I started taking this. In the last 4 months I haven't had a single cyst. I still have normal acne that remains unaffected by the fish oil, though. I am giving it 5 stars because it is quite economical compared to most other brands. One bottle lasts me almost 5 weeks. It has no vitamin A in it, so I don't have to worry about overdosing. And it totally whupped my cystic acne.

title: Don't hesitate to buy this one
body: This is a great product.  I can't swallow the capsules, even the small ones.  I was very reluctant to buy the liquid form because the expressed capsules taste so bad, but the dr says, so...  I chose this product because the previous reviews are very positive and the price was right.  It arrived quickly and it's surprisingly tolerable.  It tastes nothing like the expressed capsules and has a distinct orange smell and mild orange taste.  It's obviously oily and leaves your lips feeling oily, but a quick drink of cold water and done.  The dosing is one tsp per day, so this bottle should last about three months.  Very fair price.  If your choking half to death on those horse pills, buy this.  You won't be sorry.

title: GREAT SUPPLEMENT FOR HUMANS AND PETS
body: I bought this for my dog and cat.  It does have an orange taste they didn't like at first but the product is excellent.  Their coats are sleek and healthy.  Nearly all of the bumps (folliculitis) my dog had are subsiding.  This in conjuntion with probiotics and a very healthy wet & dry combinations of limited ingredient dog foods are your best choice in repairing the skin from the inside for canines.

title: ADHD 9 year old
body: I have been giving this to my daughter that has ADHD along with a calming supplement. She said she didn't like the taste of it when I mixed it with juice. So, I bought the Instant Breakfast chocolate drink for her and now there are no complaints. Who doesn't like chocolate?? I saw an immediate difference in her combining the two supplements.

title: great product
body: This product is a great alternative to the giant pills you have to swallow and it does not taste bad.

title: great product
body: A very easy way to take the correct doses. This is a great omega, and good flavor to drink. Thanks

title: Helps with moods and eczema
body: Great stuff. My 8 year old's moodiness (1 tsp day) and helps my 4 year olds eczema (1/2 tsp. day)

title: BEWARE! Orange Flavored/Scented
body: While the bottle shows that this oil has an orange scent and taste, none of the description items said this. I unfortunately didn't examine the product picture closely enough. I was planning on using this to mix with my dog's food, I won't be doing that now.

title: Customer service
body: I don't know which fish oil product is better than another, but when I bought this some months ago I looked at reviews of all competition and the price seemed right and the facts were good (it's all probably the same anyway.) But I do know when the cap to my bottle broke off I sent an email right off the company website and they shipped me a new one free of charge. So at least you know with this you're getting dependable customer service.

title: Be aware of the flavor
body: Its a decent product, but be aware that it is orange flavored; item description does not say that.  I bought it to add to my dog's food and she will not eat it because of the flavoring.  She eats the unflavored no problem.

title: Least Fishy Taste I've Had
body: I've tried a few other fish oils and this is by far the least fishy of them all. Also doesn't stay lingering very long. The orange taste isn't very significant but that doesn't bother me as long as I'm not burping or smelling or tasting the fish for very long.

title: Tastes great, but they've raised the price on it
body: Taste great - just like orange oil. The amount of Omega 3 you get from a spoonful of this is equal to taking over half a dozen fish pills.  This used to be a great value but I've dinged them 1 star since they've raised prices on it.

title: Wonderful Omega source!!!
body: Works very well!  Have ordered for the second time , better priced than a popular brand.... but same great benefits the Omegas are known for.  I focus better with this and I also give it to my kids.  No fishy aftertaste!

title: The caps are very weak and break every time.
body: My problem is that the caps are very weak. Every time I've gotten a new bottle, the cap has broken. I don't have Herculean strength, so I don't think it's me. If they made stronger caps, I would buy again. For now, I will have to go to a different brand/product.

title: Good product
body: Got the Omega 3 for my mom to help her health issues.

title: Great fish oil, but ease your way into it
body: Great fish oil supplement. Taste is good, orange flavor without much of an aftertaste. About as good as I can imagine for a fish oil. Definitely ease your way into it and don't take a bunch at once. I've been up to 30g a day with meals and have felt great

title: Good
body: I can't vouch for the specific health benefits of Omega 3s, but as for taste and value, this product is top notch. Seems to retain it's freshness for quite a while too, as long as you refrigerate soon after opening. Good product

title: Good taste compared to the competition
body: Good taste compared to the competition, which is the most important thing most people are looking for in a fish oil.  I can't swallow pills, so something like this was the only option for me!  Take a swig in the morning with a mouth full of orange juice or whatever to wash it down, and you won't even know you took it.  No after taste, no burping, etc.  Highly recommended!

title: It has the Omega dose that I was looking for ...
body: It has the Omega dose that I was looking for, and not a gel pill. I cannot stand the smell. Gag reflex comes in. It does it's purpose. I will be looking into powder form next however.

title: Good taste
body: The best thing of this product is the taste -- you can easily take your Omega-3 doses per day without the bad fish aftertaste. I find it awkward (or funny) that one's burps will have a strong taste/smell of orange; but considering the bad taste of fish oil... it's better!

title: Fantastic Product!
body: Our son has been on Liquid Omega 3 for quite a while.  His physician wanted to know what product we were giving him since he saw the excellent levels in his laboratory results.

title: Chrohns disease
body: I bought this because it's deffinantly cheaper than buying pills.  Research says fish oil helps with inflamation caused by Crohns disease.  I will say this stuff helps me.  I take about 1 tablespoon per day.

title: Good supplement
body: Doesn't taste like fish at all, just oil. Easy to swallow, but the flavor doesn't really go well with anything. Problem is that if I cook with it, it then makes the pot smell weird.

title: Very decent tasting
body: This fish oil tastes very good even without added sweeteners. I've been down the road of trying the xylitol-sweetened fish oils like Barleans / Coromega and I keep coming back to this Nature's Answer bottle w/ the simple flavoring since it's better value for the money.

title: It actually tastes quite good.
body: I just received my order and quite pleasantly surprised by the flavor. It actually tastes quite good.

title: Not Just for People
body: I am actually using this product for my dog.  His cardiologist suggested that I try fish oil to control his heart arrhythmia and it is actually working!  I am going to start using it for my other labs for their coat and skin.  I have reordered this product several times and am getting ready to order it again!

title: The Best Fish Oil on the Market [PERIOD]
body: I like the orange to mask the oil. Great product that was recommended by my nutritionist.

title: Fish Oil
body: I like the flavor and helps make taking fish oil a little more enjoyable.  I prefer the liquid over the capsule.  I do find that I burp more when I'm taking this and the burps are a little fishy.

title: It tastes like you licked a fish with a orange after taste
body: This has been a staple for me for 4 years now.  It tastes like you licked a fish with a orange after taste. If you can get past the taste (which isn't hard to do) you will be pleasantly surprised at the cognitive benefits.

title: Very high amount of Omega 3
body: The highest amount of Omega 3's I can find in a product without taking a ridiculous amount of capsules per day.  The taste is more of orange rind than an orange, though still much better than fish!  Having difficulty getting used to the feeling of swallowing oil (seems wrong), though getting used to it.

title: Good price and good quality fish oil
body: Good price and good quality fish oil.  There is no fishy taste to this at all, just a nice clean orange flavor.  My 3 young children like it alot surprisingly and I use it daily in my morning smoothie.  I can't say that it makes a difference in my life but I feel better knowing I have taken it.

title: Great Product
body: I have difficulty swallowing pills and Omega pills are usually very large. I began searching for a liquid alternative and saw the review for Nature's answer. I am extremely pleased with this product and so glad I gave it a try. The taste is pleasant, not fishy, and it is so easy to take.

title: Great mind and mood tonic.
body: Tastes good enough by itself. It goes down smooth. Can feel a boost within 30 minutes of just one dosage. Makes for a healthy mind.

body: Excellent product for the very reasonable price.

I told her the label says teaspoon, but I was using tablespoon b/c my doctor said to take 4gr./dy.  Rather rude.  She said, "hold the bottle upright & very carefully tip it.  I don't know what to tell you.  That's what people do."  I'll try one more time tomorrow, then the bottle is going back...After our conversation, I thought of the rubber stopper & syringes.  I called back & she said "we don't have any of those".  I may try a syringe.  Any suggestions?

title: Don't hesitate to buy this one
body: This is a great product.  I can't swallow the capsules, even the small ones.  I was very reluctant to buy the liquid form because the expressed capsules taste so bad, but the dr says, so...  I chose this product because the previous reviews are very positive and the price was right.  It arrived quickly and it's surprisingly tolerable.  It tastes nothing like the expressed capsules and has a distinct orange smell and mild orange taste.  It's obviously oily and leaves your lips feeling oily, but a quick drink of cold water and done.  The dosing is one tsp per day, so this bottle should last about three months.  Very fair price.  If your choking half to death on those horse pills, buy this.  You won't be sorry.

title: Maybe it is a new or maybe old formula????
body: So I bought these at my local Whole Foods and my 5yo loves them. So to save some money I decided to take a chance and order them online. All of the companies products had sort of mixed reviews but I had tasted them so I didn't worry about that. WELL.... these taste different. Not to a point where I have to throw them out but definitely much more of a fishy flavor than the ones I got at the store. Disappointing. Make me wonder if maybe these are older but still in date or maybe the company changed the formula. I think I will email Nordic directly.

title: Delicious
body: I purchased Nordic Omega-3 Gummy Fish after trying unsuccessfully other brands and formulas for my five year old. While my older boys enjoy Nordic Complete Omega Junior, my five year old is a supertaster, and he gags on most omega supplements. The Nordic Fish are the only omega supplement he will take, in fact likes them so much, he asks for more.  Each fish gummy contains a total of 136 mg Omega-3s and the recommended dose is one fish a day. This is the only negative, as I would prefer a higher amount of Omega-3s and taking more than one per day is not cost effective. I will definitely purchase these again and would recommend them, especially if your child is sensitive to different food tastes.

title: Terrible
body: I usually purchase the Nordic omega 3 gummys that come in the box. I purchased these and they're 5 times the size of the other gummies and have less mgs of omega 3 making it 100 times harder to get my kid to eat then. Idk what I was thinking when I ordered these. Also they have these salt like granulars on them I guess to prevent them from sticking to eachother but my 7 year old does not care for

title: Came damaged twice
body: We usually love this brand and this is a great avenue to get a high dose of fish oil in my son. We've been ordering these for a while and the last THREE have had a broken seal. Not good. Fish oils are very temperamental and you have to be careful about air exposure and heat. They should never smell fishy. So it was really surprising that these were damaged. Honestly, it looks like we got the same three bottles and they just kept put a new outer plastic ring on it. Guess we're back to buying in the store for safety.

title: Awesome!
body: My kids love these gummies.  They taste almost like candy to me as well so I'm not surprised.  I'm not sure how they did it, but the natural tangerine flavor covers up the fish oil completely. Little expensive vs buying national brands at Target or Walmart but if they eat them with no fuss, I'm in!  DO NOT, however, buy the Nordic Naturals Gummy Worms version, as they taste like licking the floor of a fish hatchery.  I'm completely baffled that the company would even remotely think a child was going to consume them.  They are supposedly berry flavored vs the tangerine flavor these have.  The worms are not even close to being edible, even for adults.

title: Expensive but worth it!
body: Great taste, my kid asks for these each morning!  And the quality is better than other brands. My kid is on the spectrum and we really notice a difference in mood and focus when he takes these consistently.

title: gummies
body: My kids love these fish vitamins.  My kids are age 7 and 4.  They ask for these "fishies" after dinner.  I would recommend you eat them with a meal and follow it with teeth brushing.  My kids like them because they are pretty sugary.  The combination of sticky and sugary are a combination for cavities, so teeth brushing is a must.  Also, these fish are huge.  I would say they are the size of 3 goldfish crackers lined up.  I haven't noticed any allergic responses, stomach problems, or smell.  Hopefully, they are effective.

body: My whole family eats these "fishy candies". My 4-year-old is a particular fan. There's no fishy flavor at all, and none of the fish burps you might experience with lesser quality omega-3 products. There are also gum-drop ones (60 count instead of 30), but you need to take two instead. Same product, as far as I can tell, aside from the shape.

title: My 5 year old loves these!
body: Luckily my daughter was able to sample these at our local natural foods market before I bought them.  She has major issues with tastes and if there was any "vitamin" taste she would not eat them.  She tried these fish and also the omega-3 gummy worms.  She loved these fish but did not like the worms.  She said the worms tasted too much like "medicine" and were "yucky."  She has one of these fish everyday and eats the whole thing which is really good for her.  I have spent tons of money on vitamins only to find out she doesn't like them and won't eat them.  She also takes the Nordic Berry vitamins daily.  We have found a winner!

title: Good Omege 3 Gummy
body: I've bought several different Nordic Naturals omega 3 products over the years. This is a good product, I like that I don't have to worry as much about the fish being pure and free from toxins. My kids have liked all the omega 3 products I have given them so far, but they did not really like these. These have more of  a tangy tangerine taste that they did not enjoy. I'll probably go back to the gummy worms from this same brand. Other than the tangy taste these actually do taste pretty good though. I tried one. The size of these fish is pretty big. I actually wasn't expecting them to be as big as they are. If your kids like more of a sour, tangy, tangerine taste then I would definitely recommend these omega 3 vitamins.

title: Got everything I was expecting
body: This product was exactly what I expected. The shipping did take a little longer than I thought it should but the transaction went smoothly. It is the same thing I was buying from our Dr. only cheaper.

title: Great taste and value!
body: Kids loved the taste and shape.  I have no problems getting them to take it daily!  We also take the Nordic gummy Multi-vites and are very happy with the Nordic Naturals products!

title: I think these taste good but my 6-year-old son rejects them most of the ...
body: I think these taste good but my 6-year-old son rejects them most of the time. They are very tangy. There is no fishy taste. I'd eat them myself but can't justify the price.

title: Good Product but Expensive
body: It is a good product and my daughter likes them, but it did upset her tummy for a few days.  It is also a bit expensive at almost a $1 a fish.

title: They love their gummy fish and we could not be happier
body: I'm writing this on behalf of my sons who are too young to craft reputable reviews.  They love their gummy fish and we could not be happier.

title: gummies are bad for teeth but they are so yummy
body: We bought these for our kid. I know, gummies are bad for teeth but they are so yummy. My wife and I eat them too and our kid loves them.

title: great for children
body: Great product! my son (who is very picky about taste and texture) loves these! I can now get omega 3 into my son without an argument!

title: Great
body: Totally delicious and the purest according to reviews. One a day and I am happy to chew at the end of the day as a sweet fix.

title: Marina

title: Been giving this to my child for almost 2 months - love it!
body: I have noticed a big difference in his health and moods, this is great quality stuff. Really helps his ADHD. We also use the multi-vitamin and do not have to give him over the counter meds at all. I recommend it but be patient, it takes some time and they need it everyday!

title: Check fish count before purchasing
body: Had no problems eating these, no burp as stated.

title: Great, easy, and tasty way to get healthy fish oil for adults
body: Tastes great and leaves no smelly aftertaste, in my experience.  Great way to get your fish oil without the wet oily smelly mess.  Highly recommend-- particularly for adults who don't take well to the oil or capsule supplements.  I however would not recommend for children as the gummy sugar part is not so great for them and also each fish is rather large.  But great, great for adults, especially fussy ones (like my husband.)

title: Yum!
body: My kids love this!  They always remember to take their fish vitamins.  Just wish it was cheaper...

title: Trying to Get Kids to Take Fish Oil.
body: Our family believes in the benefits of fish oil.  With the kids I have tried most every fish oil product (capsules, chewables, liquids).  I am not thrilled with the sugar content of this product, but this is very palatable (even enjoyable) and provides a high dose of DHA/EPA supplement.

title: Not a lot of Omega-3
body: You would have to take over 7 of these a day to make the recomended 500mg a day. My kid loved these, but it was very expensive and a lot of pills to take.

title: Two Stars
body: Arrived opened, so I returned this item.

title: Great but expensive
body: Great. My kids love them. Really expensive for how much Omega-3 you get per dose though.

title: Good.
body: These are good, but my kids like the strawberry gummy worms better!
